tester
2025-08-06 20:29:42
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - All search queries returned 429 error 'Your account has run out of searches' from the SerpAPI service. The code structure and logic are correct, but no search results were obtained due to API quota exhaustion. Zero results were collected across all 8 targeted search queries, preventing any progress toward finding the Carolyn Collins Petersen Universe Today article. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - unable to locate the target article due to API limitations. The code did successfully save an empty results summary to 'workspace/universe_today_search_results.json'. Recommended next steps: (1) Wait for API quota reset, (2) Use alternative search approach like direct web scraping of Universe Today's archive pages, or (3) Try manual browsing of universetoday.com with date-based navigation to June 6, 2023 articles.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json from datetime import datetime print("=== SEARCHING FOR CAROLYN COLLINS PETERSEN UNIVERSE TODAY ARTICLE - JUNE 6, 2023 ===\n") print("Objective: Find specific article by Carolyn Collins Petersen published on Universe Today on June 6, 2023\n") # Create workspace directory if needed if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("Created workspace directory") # Get SerpAPI key from environment api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY") if not api_key: print("Error: SERPAPI_API_KEY not found in environment variables") else: print(f"API key found: {api_key[:8]}...") # Multiple targeted search queries for the specific article search_queries = [ 'Carolyn Collins Petersen Universe Today June 6 2023', 'site:universetoday.com Carolyn Collins Petersen June 2023', '"Carolyn Collins Petersen" "Universe Today" "June 6, 2023"', 'site:universetoday.com "Carolyn Collins Petersen" "June 6"', '"Universe Today" author:"Carolyn Collins Petersen" June 2023', 'universetoday.com Carolyn Petersen June 6 2023', 'site:universetoday.com "June 6, 2023" Carolyn Collins', '"Carolyn Collins Petersen" universetoday June 6th 2023' ] print(f"Executing {len(search_queries)} targeted search queries...\n") all_search_results = [] for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f"Query {i}: {query}") # Prepare API request parameters params = { "q": query, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 15 # Get more results for comprehensive coverage } try: response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params) if response.status_code == 200: results = response.json() if results.get("organic_results"): print(f" Found {len(results['organic_results'])} results") # Process and analyze each result for j, result in enumerate(results['organic_results'], 1): result_info = { 'query_number': i, 'result_number': j, 'title': result.get('title', 'No title'), 'link': result.get('link', 'No link'), 'snippet': result.get('snippet', 'No snippet'), 'is_universe_today': 'universetoday.com' in result.get('link', '').lower(), 'has_carolyn_petersen': any(term in (result.get('snippet', '') + result.get('title', '')).lower() for term in ['carolyn collins petersen', 'carolyn petersen', 'c. petersen']), 'has_june_2023': any(term in (result.get('snippet', '') + result.get('title', '')).lower() for term in ['june 6, 2023', 'june 6 2023', 'june 2023', '6 june 2023']) } all_search_results.append(result_info) # Print relevant results immediately if result_info['is_universe_today'] and result_info['has_carolyn_petersen']: print(f" ‚òÖ EXACT MATCH CANDIDATE {j}:") print(f" Title: {result_info['title']}") print(f" Link: {result_info['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result_info['snippet'][:200]}...") print(f" June 2023 reference: {result_info['has_june_2023']}") elif result_info['is_universe_today']: print(f" ‚óÜ UNIVERSE TODAY RESULT {j}:") print(f" Title: {result_info['title'][:60]}...") print(f" Author match: {result_info['has_carolyn_petersen']}") print(f" Date match: {result_info['has_june_2023']}") elif result_info['has_carolyn_petersen'] and result_info['has_june_2023']: print(f" ‚óá RELEVANT RESULT {j}:") print(f" Title: {result_info['title'][:60]}...") print(f" Link: {result_info['link'][:50]}...") else: print(f" Result {j}: {result_info['title'][:50]}... | {result_info['link'][:40]}...") else: print(f" No organic results found") else: print(f" API Error: {response.status_code} - {response.text[:100]}...") except Exception as e: print(f" Exception during search: {str(e)}") print() # Space between queries print(f"\n=== SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_search_results)}") # Filter and prioritize Universe Today results with author match exact_matches = [r for r in all_search_results if r['is_universe_today'] and r['has_carolyn_petersen']] print(f"Exact matches (Universe Today + Carolyn Petersen): {len(exact_matches)}") # Filter Universe Today results universe_today_results = [r for r in all_search_results if r['is_universe_today']] print(f"All Universe Today results: {len(universe_today_results)}") # Filter results with author and date author_date_matches = [r for r in all_search_results if r['has_carolyn_petersen'] and r['has_june_2023']] print(f"Results with author + June 2023: {len(author_date_matches)}") if exact_matches: print("\n=== EXACT MATCH CANDIDATES ===\n") for i, result in enumerate(exact_matches, 1): print(f"{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f" June 2023 match: {result['has_june_2023']}") print(f" From Query: {result['query_number']}") print() # Access the most promising Universe Today articles print(f"\n=== ACCESSING UNIVERSE TODAY ARTICLES ===\n") print(f"Attempting to access {len(exact_matches)} exact match candidates...") accessed_articles = [] for i, result in enumerate(exact_matches, 1): target_url = result['link'] print(f"\n{i}. Accessing: {target_url}") try: headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } page_response = requests.get(target_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if page_response.status_code == 200: print(f" ‚úì Successfully accessed (Status: {page_response.status_code})") print(f" Content length: {len(page_response.content):,} bytes") # Parse the HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(page_response.content, 'html.parser') # Extract key information from the page page_title = soup.find('title') if page_title: print(f" Page title: {page_title.get_text().strip()}") # Look for author information author_selectors = [ '.author', '.byline', '[class*="author"]', '.entry-author', '.post-author' ] author_found = None for selector in author_selectors: author_element = soup.select_one(selector) if author_element and 'carolyn' in author_element.get_text().lower(): author_found = author_element.get_text().strip() break if author_found: print(f" Author found: {author_found}") else: print(f" Author: Searching in page text...") page_text = soup.get_text() if 'carolyn collins petersen' in page_text.lower(): print(f" Author: Carolyn Collins Petersen (found in text)") # Look for publication date date_selectors = [ '.date', '.published', '.entry-date', '.post-date', '[class*="date"]', 'time' ] date_found = None for selector in date_selectors: date_element = soup.select_one(selector) if date_element: date_text = date_element.get_text().strip() if 'june' in date_text.lower() and ('2023' in date_text or '6' in date_text): date_found = date_text break if date_found: print(f" Date found: {date_found}") else: print(f" Date: Searching in page text...") if 'june 6, 2023' in page_text.lower(): print(f" Date: June 6, 2023 (found in text)") # Look for research paper links at the bottom print(f" Searching for research paper links...") # Find all links that might be research papers all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) research_links = [] research_indicators = [ 'arxiv.org', 'doi.org', 'nature.com', 'science.org', 'iopscience.iop.org', 'academic.oup.com', 'journals.', 'paper', 'study', 'research', 'publication' ] for link in all_links: href = link.get('href', '').lower() link_text = link.get_text().strip().lower() # Check if this looks like a research paper link if any(indicator in href or indicator in link_text for indicator in research_indicators): research_links.append({ 'url': link.get('href'), 'text': link.get_text().strip(), 'context_position': str(link)[:100] }) print(f" Found {len(research_links)} potential research paper links") # Save the article content safe_filename = target_url.replace('https://', '').replace('http://', '').replace('/', '_').replace(':', '_') html_filename = f'workspace/universe_today_article_{safe_filename}.html' with open(html_filename, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(page_response.text) print(f" ‚úì Article content saved to: {html_filename}") # Store article information article_info = { 'url': target_url, 'title': page_title.get_text().strip() if page_title else 'No title', 'filename': html_filename, 'content_length': len(page_response.content), 'author_found': author_found, 'date_found': date_found, 'research_links_count': len(research_links), 'research_links': research_links[:10], # Store first 10 links 'search_result': result } accessed_articles.append(article_info) else: print(f" ‚úó Failed to access (Status: {page_response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Exception accessing article: {str(e)}") elif universe_today_results: print("\n‚ö†Ô∏è No exact matches found, but Universe Today results available") print(f"Found {len(universe_today_results)} Universe Today results to examine:") for i, result in enumerate(universe_today_results[:3], 1): # Show first 3 print(f"{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Author match: {result['has_carolyn_petersen']}") print(f" Date match: {result['has_june_2023']}") print() else: print("\n‚ùå No Universe Today results found") print("Checking other relevant results...") if author_date_matches: print(f"\nFound {len(author_date_matches)} results with author + date match:") for i, result in enumerate(author_date_matches[:5], 1): # Show first 5 print(f"{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:150]}...") print() # Compile comprehensive search results search_summary = { 'search_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_author': 'Carolyn Collins Petersen', 'target_site': 'Universe Today', 'target_date': 'June 6, 2023', 'objective': 'Find specific article and identify linked research paper', 'search_queries': search_queries, 'total_search_results': len(all_search_results), 'exact_matches': len(exact_matches), 'universe_today_results': len(universe_today_results), 'author_date_matches': len(author_date_matches), 'accessed_articles': accessed_articles if 'accessed_articles' in locals() else [], 'all_search_results': all_search_results } # Save comprehensive results summary_filename = 'workspace/universe_today_search_results.json' with open(summary_filename, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_summary, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== SEARCH PHASE COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Search results summary:") print(f"- Total search results: {len(all_search_results)}") print(f"- Exact matches: {len(exact_matches)}") print(f"- Universe Today results: {len(universe_today_results)}") print(f"- Author + date matches: {len(author_date_matches)}") if 'accessed_articles' in locals(): print(f"- Articles accessed: {len(accessed_articles)}") print(f"\nFiles created:") for article in accessed_articles: print(f"- {article['filename']}") if article['research_links']: print(f" Research links found: {article['research_links_count']}") for link in article['research_links'][:3]: # Show first 3 print(f" - {link['text'][:50]}... -> {link['url'][:60]}...") print(f"\nSummary saved to: {summary_filename}") if 'accessed_articles' in locals() and accessed_articles: print(f"\nüéØ SUCCESS: Found and accessed Universe Today article(s) by Carolyn Collins Petersen") print(f"Next step: Parse the saved HTML files to extract the research paper link from the bottom of the article") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No articles successfully accessed yet") print(f"Next step: Review search results and try accessing the most promising candidates")
Execution Output
Code Output: === SEARCHING FOR CAROLYN COLLINS PETERSEN UNIVERSE TODAY ARTICLE - JUNE 6, 2023 === Objective: Find specific article by Carolyn Collins Petersen published on Universe Today on June 6, 2023 API key found: dd8a6d90... Executing 8 targeted search queries... Query 1: Carolyn Collins Petersen Universe Today June 6 2023 API Error: 429 - { "error": "Your account has run out of searches." }... Query 2: site:universetoday.com Carolyn Collins Petersen June 2023 API Error: 429 - { "error": "Your account has run out of searches." }... Query 3: "Carolyn Collins Petersen" "Universe Today" "June 6, 2023" API Error: 429 - { "error": "Your account has run out of searches." }... Query 4: site:universetoday.com "Carolyn Collins Petersen" "June 6" API Error: 429 - { "error": "Your account has run out of searches." }... Query 5: "Universe Today" author:"Carolyn Collins Petersen" June 2023 API Error: 429 - { "error": "Your account has run out of searches." }... Query 6: universetoday.com Carolyn Petersen June 6 2023 API Error: 429 - { "error": "Your account has run out of searches." }... Query 7: site:universetoday.com "June 6, 2023" Carolyn Collins API Error: 429 - { "error": "Your account has run out of searches." }... Query 8: "Carolyn Collins Petersen" universetoday June 6th 2023 API Error: 429 - { "error": "Your account has run out of searches." }... === SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY === Total results collected: 0 Exact matches (Universe Today + Carolyn Petersen): 0 All Universe Today results: 0 Results with author + June 2023: 0 ‚ùå No Universe Today results found Checking other relevant results... === SEARCH PHASE COMPLETE === Search results summary: - Total search results: 0 - Exact matches: 0 - Universe Today results: 0 - Author + date matches: 0 Summary saved to: workspace_840bfca7-4f7b-481a-8794-c560c340185d/universe_today_search_results.json ‚ö†Ô∏è No articles successfully accessed yet Next step: Review search results and try accessing the most promising candidates
developer
2025-08-06 20:31:19
Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 2)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json from datetime import datetime import re import time print("=== DIRECT WEB SCRAPING APPROACH FOR UNIVERSE TODAY ARTICLE ===\n") print("Objective: Find Carolyn Collins Petersen article from June 6, 2023 via direct web access\n") # Create workspace directory if needed if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("Created workspace directory") # Set up headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } print("=== STRATEGY 1: DIRECT ACCESS TO UNIVERSE TODAY ARCHIVE PAGES ===\n") # Try multiple Universe Today URL patterns that might contain June 2023 articles target_urls = [ { 'name': 'Universe Today Main Page', 'url': 'https://www.universetoday.com', 'description': 'Main page to understand site structure' }, { 'name': 'Universe Today June 2023 Archive', 'url': 'https://www.universetoday.com/2023/06/', 'description': 'Direct archive page for June 2023' }, { 'name': 'Universe Today Author Page - Carolyn Collins Petersen', 'url': 'https://www.universetoday.com/author/carolyn-collins-petersen/', 'description': 'Author-specific page for Carolyn Collins Petersen' }, { 'name': 'Universe Today Search Page', 'url': 'https://www.universetoday.com/?s=Carolyn+Collins+Petersen', 'description': 'Internal search for the author' }, { 'name': 'Universe Today June 6, 2023 Direct Date URL', 'url': 'https://www.universetoday.com/2023/06/06/', 'description': 'Direct date-based URL for June 6, 2023' } ] successful_accesses = [] found_articles = [] for i, target in enumerate(target_urls, 1): print(f"\nAccessing {i}. {target['name']}") print(f"URL: {target['url']}") print(f"Purpose: {target['description']}") try: response = requests.get(target['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úì Successfully accessed (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") # Parse the content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Remove script and style elements for script in soup(["script", "style"]): script.decompose() # Get text content text = soup.get_text() # Clean up text lines = (line.strip() for line in text.splitlines()) chunks = (phrase.strip() for line in lines for phrase in line.split(" ")) clean_text = ' '.join(chunk for chunk in chunks if chunk) # Save the content filename = f"universe_today_direct_{i}_{target['name'].replace(' ', '_').replace('/', '_').replace(',', '').replace('-', '_')}.txt" filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(f"Source: {target['name']}\n") f.write(f"URL: {target['url']}\n") f.write(f"Purpose: {target['description']}\n") f.write(f"Accessed: {response.status_code}\n") f.write(f"Content Length: {len(clean_text):,} characters\n") f.write("=" * 50 + "\n") f.write(clean_text) print(f"Content saved to: {filename}") print(f"Text length: {len(clean_text):,} characters") # Search for Carolyn Collins Petersen references author_patterns = [ r'carolyn collins petersen', r'carolyn petersen', r'c\. petersen', r'by carolyn' ] found_author_refs = [] content_lower = clean_text.lower() for pattern in author_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, content_lower)) if matches: for match in matches: # Get context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 100) end = min(len(clean_text), match.end() + 100) context = clean_text[start:end] found_author_refs.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'match': match.group(), 'position': match.start(), 'context': context.replace('\n', ' ').strip() }) # Search for June 2023 date references date_patterns = [ r'june 6,? 2023', r'june 6th,? 2023', r'6 june 2023', r'2023-06-06', r'06/06/2023' ] found_date_refs = [] for pattern in date_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, content_lower)) if matches: for match in matches: start = max(0, match.start() - 100) end = min(len(clean_text), match.end() + 100) context = clean_text[start:end] found_date_refs.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'match': match.group(), 'position': match.start(), 'context': context.replace('\n', ' ').strip() }) print(f"Author references found: {len(found_author_refs)}") print(f"June 6, 2023 references found: {len(found_date_refs)}") # Look for article links in the HTML article_links = [] # Find all links that might be articles all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) for link in all_links: href = link.get('href', '') link_text = link.get_text().strip() # Check if this looks like a Universe Today article link if ('universetoday.com' in href or href.startswith('/')) and len(link_text) > 20: # Check if it contains author or date information if any(term in link_text.lower() for term in ['carolyn', 'june', '2023']): article_links.append({ 'url': href, 'text': link_text[:100], 'full_url': href if href.startswith('http') else f"https://www.universetoday.com{href}" }) print(f"Potential article links found: {len(article_links)}") # If we found both author and date references, this might be our target page if found_author_refs and found_date_refs: print(f"‚òÖ POTENTIAL TARGET PAGE FOUND!") print(f" Author refs: {len(found_author_refs)}") print(f" Date refs: {len(found_date_refs)}") found_articles.append({ 'source_page': target['name'], 'source_url': target['url'], 'filename': filename, 'author_refs': found_author_refs, 'date_refs': found_date_refs, 'article_links': article_links }) # Show first few author and date references if found if found_author_refs: print(f"\n Author references:") for ref in found_author_refs[:3]: print(f" - {ref['match']} at pos {ref['position']:,}") print(f" Context: ...{ref['context'][:150]}...") if found_date_refs: print(f"\n Date references:") for ref in found_date_refs[:3]: print(f" - {ref['match']} at pos {ref['position']:,}") print(f" Context: ...{ref['context'][:150]}...") if article_links: print(f"\n Article links (first 3):") for link in article_links[:3]: print(f" - {link['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {link['full_url']}") successful_accesses.append({ 'name': target['name'], 'url': target['url'], 'filename': filename, 'content_length': len(clean_text), 'author_refs': len(found_author_refs), 'date_refs': len(found_date_refs), 'article_links': len(article_links), 'status': 'success' }) else: print(f"‚úó Failed to access (Status: {response.status_code})") successful_accesses.append({ 'name': target['name'], 'url': target['url'], 'status': f'failed_{response.status_code}', 'error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e: print(f"‚úó Request failed: {e}") successful_accesses.append({ 'name': target['name'], 'url': target['url'], 'status': 'error', 'error': str(e) }) print("-" * 60) time.sleep(1) # Be respectful to the server print(f"\n=== STRATEGY 2: ACCESSING SPECIFIC ARTICLE LINKS ===\n") # If we found article links, try to access them accessed_articles = [] for found_article in found_articles: print(f"Processing article links from: {found_article['source_page']}") for i, link in enumerate(found_article['article_links'][:5], 1): # Try first 5 links print(f"\n Accessing article link {i}: {link['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {link['full_url']}") try: response = requests.get(link['full_url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f" ‚úì Successfully accessed (Status: {response.status_code})") # Parse the article content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Extract article title title_selectors = ['h1', '.entry-title', '.post-title', 'title'] article_title = None for selector in title_selectors: title_element = soup.select_one(selector) if title_element: article_title = title_element.get_text().strip() break print(f" Title: {article_title}") # Check for author in the article author_in_article = 'carolyn collins petersen' in soup.get_text().lower() print(f" Author found: {author_in_article}") # Check for June 6, 2023 date date_in_article = any(date_term in soup.get_text().lower() for date_term in ['june 6, 2023', 'june 6 2023', '2023-06-06']) print(f" Target date found: {date_in_article}") # If this looks like our target article, save it and look for research paper links if author_in_article and (date_in_article or 'june' in soup.get_text().lower()): print(f" ‚òÖ POTENTIAL TARGET ARTICLE FOUND!") # Save the full article safe_filename = link['full_url'].replace('https://', '').replace('http://', '').replace('/', '_').replace(':', '_') article_filename = f'workspace/target_article_{safe_filename}.html' with open(article_filename, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f" ‚úì Article saved to: {article_filename}") # Look for research paper links at the bottom print(f" Searching for research paper links...") # Get the article text content article_text = soup.get_text() # Find all links that might be research papers all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) research_links = [] research_indicators = [ 'arxiv.org', 'doi.org', 'nature.com', 'science.org', 'iopscience.iop.org', 'academic.oup.com', 'journals.', 'adsabs.harvard.edu', 'paper', 'study', 'research', 'publication' ] for research_link in all_links: href = research_link.get('href', '').lower() link_text = research_link.get_text().strip().lower() # Check if this looks like a research paper link if any(indicator in href or indicator in link_text for indicator in research_indicators): research_links.append({ 'url': research_link.get('href'), 'text': research_link.get_text().strip(), 'position_in_html': str(research_link.parent)[:200] if research_link.parent else 'N/A' }) print(f" Found {len(research_links)} potential research paper links") # Show the research links if research_links: print(f"\n Research paper links found:") for j, rlink in enumerate(research_links, 1): print(f" {j}. {rlink['text'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {rlink['url']}") accessed_articles.append({ 'url': link['full_url'], 'title': article_title, 'filename': article_filename, 'author_confirmed': author_in_article, 'date_confirmed': date_in_article, 'research_links': research_links, 'research_links_count': len(research_links) }) else: print(f" Not the target article (author: {author_in_article}, date: {date_in_article})") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed to access (Status: {response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Exception: {str(e)}") time.sleep(1) # Be respectful to the server # Save comprehensive results direct_search_results = { 'search_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'strategy': 'Direct web scraping of Universe Today website', 'target_author': 'Carolyn Collins Petersen', 'target_site': 'Universe Today', 'target_date': 'June 6, 2023', 'objective': 'Find specific article and identify linked research paper', 'urls_attempted': len(target_urls), 'successful_accesses': len([a for a in successful_accesses if a.get('status') == 'success']), 'potential_articles_found': len(found_articles), 'accessed_articles': accessed_articles, 'access_details': successful_accesses, 'found_articles_details': found_articles } # Save results results_filename = 'workspace/universe_today_direct_search_results.json' with open(results_filename, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(direct_search_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== DIRECT SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"URLs attempted: {len(target_urls)}") print(f"Successful accesses: {direct_search_results['successful_accesses']}") print(f"Potential articles found: {len(found_articles)}") print(f"Articles accessed and analyzed: {len(accessed_articles)}") print(f"Results saved to: {results_filename}") if accessed_articles: print(f"\nüéØ TARGET ARTICLE CANDIDATES:") for i, article in enumerate(accessed_articles, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Author confirmed: {article['author_confirmed']}") print(f" Date confirmed: {article['date_confirmed']}") print(f" Research links found: {article['research_links_count']}") print(f" Saved to: {article['filename']}") if article['research_links']: print(f" üî¨ RESEARCH PAPER LINKS:") for j, rlink in enumerate(article['research_links'][:3], 1): print(f" {j}. {rlink['text'][:60]}...") print(f" {rlink['url']}") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No target articles successfully identified yet") print(f"Next steps: Review the downloaded content files for manual analysis") print(f"\nWorkspace files created:") for file in os.listdir('workspace'): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") print(f"\n=== NEXT STEPS ===\n") if accessed_articles: print("‚úì Successfully found potential target article(s)") print("‚úì Extracted research paper links from article(s)") print("Next: Analyze the research paper links to identify the specific study") else: print("Continue manual analysis of downloaded content files") print("Look for article URLs or additional navigation options") print("Consider trying alternative date formats or URL patterns")

Universe Today Main Page URL: https://www.universetoday.com Purpose: Main page to understand site structure Status: 404 ‚úó Page not found (404) ‚úì Successfully accessed (Status: 200) Content length: 73,524 bytes Content saved to: universe_today_direct_1_Universe_Today_Main_Page.txt Text length: 28,732 characters Author references found: 6 June 6, 2023 references found: 0 Execution error: NameError: name 'link_text' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/liujiarui.1/Documents/È°πÁõÆ/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code """Python interpreter main class""" ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 167, in <module> File "<string>", line 167, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'link_text' is not defined

Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code encountered a NameError: name 'link_text' is not defined at line 167. While the code successfully accessed the Universe Today main page (Status 200) and found 6 author references for Carolyn Collins Petersen, it crashed during the article link processing section due to an undefined variable. The code managed to save initial content to 'universe_today_direct_1_Universe_Today_Main_Page.txt' with 28,732 characters of text, but failed to complete the full analysis. **PLAN** alignment: 15% - partial progress made by accessing the main site and detecting author references, but unable to complete the search due to the variable error. Recommended fix: Define the 'link_text' variable properly in the article link processing loop around line 167, likely by ensuring 'link.get_text().strip()' is assigned to 'link_text' before using it in the generator expression.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json from datetime import datetime import re import time print("=== DIRECT WEB SCRAPING APPROACH FOR UNIVERSE TODAY ARTICLE ===\n") print("Objective: Find Carolyn Collins Petersen article from June 6, 2023 via direct web access\n") # Create workspace directory if needed if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("Created workspace directory") # Set up headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } print("=== STRATEGY 1: DIRECT ACCESS TO UNIVERSE TODAY ARCHIVE PAGES ===\n") # Try multiple Universe Today URL patterns that might contain June 2023 articles target_urls = [ { 'name': 'Universe Today Main Page', 'url': 'https://www.universetoday.com', 'description': 'Main page to understand site structure' }, { 'name': 'Universe Today June 2023 Archive', 'url': 'https://www.universetoday.com/2023/06/', 'description': 'Direct archive page for June 2023' }, { 'name': 'Universe Today Author Page - Carolyn Collins Petersen', 'url': 'https://www.universetoday.com/author/carolyn-collins-petersen/', 'description': 'Author-specific page for Carolyn Collins Petersen' }, { 'name': 'Universe Today Search Page', 'url': 'https://www.universetoday.com/?s=Carolyn+Collins+Petersen', 'description': 'Internal search for the author' }, { 'name': 'Universe Today June 6, 2023 Direct Date URL', 'url': 'https://www.universetoday.com/2023/06/06/', 'description': 'Direct date-based URL for June 6, 2023' } ] successful_accesses = [] found_articles = [] for i, target in enumerate(target_urls, 1): print(f"\nAccessing {i}. {target['name']}") print(f"URL: {target['url']}") print(f"Purpose: {target['description']}") try: response = requests.get(target['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úì Successfully accessed (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") # Parse the content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Remove script and style elements for script in soup(["script", "style"]): script.decompose() # Get text content text = soup.get_text() # Clean up text lines = (line.strip() for line in text.splitlines()) chunks = (phrase.strip() for line in lines for phrase in line.split(" ")) clean_text = ' '.join(chunk for chunk in chunks if chunk) # Save the content filename = f"universe_today_direct_{i}_{target['name'].replace(' ', '_').replace('/', '_').replace(',', '').replace('-', '_')}.txt" filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(f"Source: {target['name']}\n") f.write(f"URL: {target['url']}\n") f.write(f"Purpose: {target['description']}\n") f.write(f"Accessed: {response.status_code}\n") f.write(f"Content Length: {len(clean_text):,} characters\n") f.write("=" * 50 + "\n") f.write(clean_text) print(f"Content saved to: {filename}") print(f"Text length: {len(clean_text):,} characters") # Search for Carolyn Collins Petersen references author_patterns = [ r'carolyn collins petersen', r'carolyn petersen', r'c\. petersen', r'by carolyn' ] found_author_refs = [] content_lower = clean_text.lower() for pattern in author_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, content_lower)) if matches: for match in matches: # Get context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 100) end = min(len(clean_text), match.end() + 100) context = clean_text[start:end] found_author_refs.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'match': match.group(), 'position': match.start(), 'context': context.replace('\n', ' ').strip() }) # Search for June 2023 date references date_patterns = [ r'june 6,? 2023', r'june 6th,? 2023', r'6 june 2023', r'2023-06-06', r'06/06/2023' ] found_date_refs = [] for pattern in date_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, content_lower)) if matches: for match in matches: start = max(0, match.start() - 100) end = min(len(clean_text), match.end() + 100) context = clean_text[start:end] found_date_refs.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'match': match.group(), 'position': match.start(), 'context': context.replace('\n', ' ').strip() }) print(f"Author references found: {len(found_author_refs)}") print(f"June 6, 2023 references found: {len(found_date_refs)}") # Look for article links in the HTML article_links = [] # Find all links that might be articles all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) for link in all_links: href = link.get('href', '') link_text = link.get_text().strip() # Check if this looks like a Universe Today article link if ('universetoday.com' in href or href.startswith('/')) and len(link_text) > 20: # Check if it contains author or date information if any(term in link_text.lower() for term in ['carolyn', 'june', '2023']): article_links.append({ 'url': href, 'text': link_text[:100], 'full_url': href if href.startswith('http') else f"https://www.universetoday.com{href}" }) print(f"Potential article links found: {len(article_links)}") # If we found both author and date references, this might be our target page if found_author_refs and found_date_refs: print(f"‚òÖ POTENTIAL TARGET PAGE FOUND!") print(f" Author refs: {len(found_author_refs)}") print(f" Date refs: {len(found_date_refs)}") found_articles.append({ 'source_page': target['name'], 'source_url': target['url'], 'filename': filename, 'author_refs': found_author_refs, 'date_refs': found_date_refs, 'article_links': article_links }) # Show first few author and date references if found if found_author_refs: print(f"\n Author references:") for ref in found_author_refs[:3]: print(f" - {ref['match']} at pos {ref['position']:,}") print(f" Context: ...{ref['context'][:150]}...") if found_date_refs: print(f"\n Date references:") for ref in found_date_refs[:3]: print(f" - {ref['match']} at pos {ref['position']:,}") print(f" Context: ...{ref['context'][:150]}...") if article_links: print(f"\n Article links (first 3):") for link in article_links[:3]: print(f" - {link['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {link['full_url']}") successful_accesses.append({ 'name': target['name'], 'url': target['url'], 'filename': filename, 'content_length': len(clean_text), 'author_refs': len(found_author_refs), 'date_refs': len(found_date_refs), 'article_links': len(article_links), 'status': 'success' }) else: print(f"‚úó Failed to access (Status: {response.status_code})") successful_accesses.append({ 'name': target['name'], 'url': target['url'], 'status': f'failed_{response.status_code}', 'error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e: print(f"‚úó Request failed: {e}") successful_accesses.append({ 'name': target['name'], 'url': target['url'], 'status': 'error', 'error': str(e) }) print("-" * 60) time.sleep(1) # Be respectful to the server print(f"\n=== STRATEGY 2: ACCESSING SPECIFIC ARTICLE LINKS ===\n") # If we found article links, try to access them accessed_articles = [] for found_article in found_articles: print(f"Processing article links from: {found_article['source_page']}") for i, link in enumerate(found_article['article_links'][:5], 1): # Try first 5 links print(f"\n Accessing article link {i}: {link['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {link['full_url']}") try: response = requests.get(link['full_url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f" ‚úì Successfully accessed (Status: {response.status_code})") # Parse the article content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Extract article title title_selectors = ['h1', '.entry-title', '.post-title', 'title'] article_title = None for selector in title_selectors: title_element = soup.select_one(selector) if title_element: article_title = title_element.get_text().strip() break print(f" Title: {article_title}") # Check for author in the article author_in_article = 'carolyn collins petersen' in soup.get_text().lower() print(f" Author found: {author_in_article}") # Check for June 6, 2023 date date_in_article = any(date_term in soup.get_text().lower() for date_term in ['june 6, 2023', 'june 6 2023', '2023-06-06']) print(f" Target date found: {date_in_article}") # If this looks like our target article, save it and look for research paper links if author_in_article and (date_in_article or 'june' in soup.get_text().lower()): print(f" ‚òÖ POTENTIAL TARGET ARTICLE FOUND!") # Save the full article safe_filename = link['full_url'].replace('https://', '').replace('http://', '').replace('/', '_').replace(':', '_') article_filename = f'workspace/target_article_{safe_filename}.html' with open(article_filename, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f" ‚úì Article saved to: {article_filename}") # Look for research paper links at the bottom print(f" Searching for research paper links...") # Get the article text content article_text = soup.get_text() # Find all links that might be research papers all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) research_links = [] research_indicators = [ 'arxiv.org', 'doi.org', 'nature.com', 'science.org', 'iopscience.iop.org', 'academic.oup.com', 'journals.', 'adsabs.harvard.edu', 'paper', 'study', 'research', 'publication' ] for research_link in all_links: href = research_link.get('href', '').lower() link_text = research_link.get_text().strip().lower() # Check if this looks like a research paper link if any(indicator in href or indicator in link_text for indicator in research_indicators): research_links.append({ 'url': research_link.get('href'), 'text': research_link.get_text().strip(), 'position_in_html': str(research_link.parent)[:200] if research_link.parent else 'N/A' }) print(f" Found {len(research_links)} potential research paper links") # Show the research links if research_links: print(f"\n Research paper links found:") for j, rlink in enumerate(research_links, 1): print(f" {j}. {rlink['text'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {rlink['url']}") accessed_articles.append({ 'url': link['full_url'], 'title': article_title, 'filename': article_filename, 'author_confirmed': author_in_article, 'date_confirmed': date_in_article, 'research_links': research_links, 'research_links_count': len(research_links) }) else: print(f" Not the target article (author: {author_in_article}, date: {date_in_article})") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed to access (Status: {response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Exception: {str(e)}") time.sleep(1) # Be respectful to the server # Save comprehensive results direct_search_results = { 'search_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'strategy': 'Direct web scraping of Universe Today website', 'target_author': 'Carolyn Collins Petersen', 'target_site': 'Universe Today', 'target_date': 'June 6, 2023', 'objective': 'Find specific article and identify linked research paper', 'urls_attempted': len(target_urls), 'successful_accesses': len([a for a in successful_accesses if a.get('status') == 'success']), 'potential_articles_found': len(found_articles), 'accessed_articles': accessed_articles, 'access_details': successful_accesses, 'found_articles_details': found_articles } # Save results results_filename = 'workspace/universe_today_direct_search_results.json' with open(results_filename, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(direct_search_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== DIRECT SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"URLs attempted: {len(target_urls)}") print(f"Successful accesses: {direct_search_results['successful_accesses']}") print(f"Potential articles found: {len(found_articles)}") print(f"Articles accessed and analyzed: {len(accessed_articles)}") print(f"Results saved to: {results_filename}") if accessed_articles: print(f"\nüéØ TARGET ARTICLE CANDIDATES:") for i, article in enumerate(accessed_articles, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Author confirmed: {article['author_confirmed']}") print(f" Date confirmed: {article['date_confirmed']}") print(f" Research links found: {article['research_links_count']}") print(f" Saved to: {article['filename']}") if article['research_links']: print(f" üî¨ RESEARCH PAPER LINKS:") for j, rlink in enumerate(article['research_links'][:3], 1): print(f" {j}. {rlink['text'][:60]}...") print(f" {rlink['url']}") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No target articles successfully identified yet") print(f"Next steps: Review the downloaded content files for manual analysis") print(f"\nWorkspace files created:") for file in os.listdir('workspace'): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") print(f"\n=== NEXT STEPS ===\n") if accessed_articles: print("‚úì Successfully found potential target article(s)") print("‚úì Extracted research paper links from article(s)") print("Next: Analyze the research paper links to identify the specific study") else: print("Continue manual analysis of downloaded content files") print("Look for article URLs or additional navigation options") print("Consider trying alternative date formats or URL patterns")
Execution Output
Code Output: === DIRECT WEB SCRAPING APPROACH FOR UNIVERSE TODAY ARTICLE === Objective: Find Carolyn Collins Petersen article from June 6, 2023 via direct web access === STRATEGY 1: DIRECT ACCESS TO UNIVERSE TODAY ARCHIVE PAGES === Accessing 1. Universe Today Main Page URL: https://www.universetoday.com Purpose: Main page to understand site structure Status: 404 ‚úó Page not found (404) ‚úì Successfully accessed (Status: 200) Content length: 73,524 bytes Content saved to: universe_today_direct_1_Universe_Today_Main_Page.txt Text length: 28,732 characters Author references found: 6 June 6, 2023 references found: 0 Execution error: NameError: name 'link_text' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/liujiarui.1/Documents/È°πÁõÆ/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code """Python interpreter main class""" ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 167, in <module> File "<string>", line 167, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'link_text' is not defined

2025-08-06 20:32:50
Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 3)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json from datetime import datetime import re import time print("=== FIXED DIRECT WEB SCRAPING FOR UNIVERSE TODAY ARTICLE ===\n") print("Objective: Find Carolyn Collins Petersen article from June 6, 2023 via direct web access\n") # Create workspace directory if needed if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("Created workspace directory") # First, let's check what we already have in workspace print("=== INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE CONTENT ===\n") workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Existing files in workspace: {len(workspace_files)}") for file in workspace_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Check if we already have the main page content main_page_file = None for file in workspace_files: if 'Universe_Today_Main_Page' in file: main_page_file = file break if main_page_file: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING EXISTING MAIN PAGE CONTENT ===\n") print(f"Found existing main page file: {main_page_file}") main_page_path = os.path.join('workspace', main_page_file) with open(main_page_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: main_page_content = f.read() print(f"Content length: {len(main_page_content):,} characters") # Extract the actual content (skip the header) content_start = main_page_content.find('=' * 50) if content_start != -1: actual_content = main_page_content[content_start + 50:] else: actual_content = main_page_content print(f"Actual content length: {len(actual_content):,} characters") # Search for Carolyn Collins Petersen references and article links print("\n=== SEARCHING FOR AUTHOR AND ARTICLE REFERENCES ===\n") # Look for author references author_patterns = [ r'carolyn collins petersen', r'carolyn petersen', r'c\. petersen', r'by carolyn' ] found_author_refs = [] content_lower = actual_content.lower() for pattern in author_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, content_lower)) if matches: for match in matches: # Get context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 150) end = min(len(actual_content), match.end() + 150) context = actual_content[start:end] found_author_refs.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'match': match.group(), 'position': match.start(), 'context': context.replace('\n', ' ').strip() }) print(f"Author references found: {len(found_author_refs)}") # Show author references with context for i, ref in enumerate(found_author_refs, 1): print(f"\n{i}. Author reference: '{ref['match']}' at position {ref['position']:,}") print(f" Context: ...{ref['context'][:200]}...") # Look for article URLs or links that might contain the target article print(f"\n=== EXTRACTING ARTICLE URLS FROM MAIN PAGE ===\n") # Parse the original HTML to get proper links # We need to re-fetch or find the HTML version print("Re-accessing main page to get proper HTML structure...") headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } try: response = requests.get('https://www.universetoday.com', headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úì Successfully re-accessed main page (Status: {response.status_code})") # Parse the HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for article links print("\n=== EXTRACTING ARTICLE LINKS ===\n") # Find all links that might be articles all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) article_links = [] for link in all_links: href = link.get('href', '') text = link.get_text().strip() # Check if this looks like a Universe Today article link if href and text and len(text) > 10: # Look for links that might be articles (contain year/date or are long enough) if (('2023' in href or '/2023/' in href) and (href.startswith('/') or 'universetoday.com' in href)): full_url = href if href.startswith('http') else f"https://www.universetoday.com{href}" # Check if the link text or URL contains relevant keywords relevant_keywords = ['carolyn', 'june', '2023', 'petersen'] is_relevant = any(keyword in text.lower() or keyword in href.lower() for keyword in relevant_keywords) article_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': text[:100], 'href': href, 'is_relevant': is_relevant }) print(f"Total article links found: {len(article_links)}") # Prioritize relevant links relevant_links = [link for link in article_links if link['is_relevant']] print(f"Relevant article links: {len(relevant_links)}") # Show relevant links if relevant_links: print(f"\nRelevant article links found:") for i, link in enumerate(relevant_links[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f"\n{i}. {link['text'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {link['url']}") print(f" Relevant: {link['is_relevant']}") # Try accessing the most promising links print(f"\n=== ACCESSING PROMISING ARTICLE LINKS ===\n") accessed_articles = [] links_to_try = relevant_links[:5] if relevant_links else article_links[:5] for i, link in enumerate(links_to_try, 1): print(f"\nAccessing article {i}: {link['text'][:60]}...") print(f"URL: {link['url']}") try: article_response = requests.get(link['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if article_response.status_code == 200: print(f" ‚úì Successfully accessed (Status: {article_response.status_code})") # Parse the article content article_soup = BeautifulSoup(article_response.text, 'html.parser') # Extract article title title_selectors = ['h1', '.entry-title', '.post-title', 'title'] article_title = 'No title found' for selector in title_selectors: title_element = article_soup.select_one(selector) if title_element: article_title = title_element.get_text().strip() break print(f" Title: {article_title}") # Get article text content article_text = article_soup.get_text().lower() # Check for author in the article author_in_article = 'carolyn collins petersen' in article_text print(f" Author found: {author_in_article}") # Check for June 6, 2023 date date_patterns = ['june 6, 2023', 'june 6 2023', '2023-06-06', 'june 6th, 2023'] date_in_article = any(date_pattern in article_text for date_pattern in date_patterns) print(f" Target date found: {date_in_article}") # If this looks like our target article, save it and look for research paper links if author_in_article and ('june' in article_text or date_in_article): print(f" ‚òÖ POTENTIAL TARGET ARTICLE FOUND!") # Save the full article safe_filename = link['url'].replace('https://', '').replace('http://', '').replace('/', '_').replace(':', '_').replace('?', '_').replace('&', '_') article_filename = f'workspace/target_article_{safe_filename}.html' with open(article_filename, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(article_response.text) print(f" ‚úì Article saved to: {article_filename}") # Look for research paper links print(f" Searching for research paper links...") # Find all links that might be research papers research_links = [] research_indicators = [ 'arxiv.org', 'doi.org', 'nature.com', 'science.org', 'iopscience.iop.org', 'academic.oup.com', 'journals.', 'adsabs.harvard.edu', 'paper', 'study', 'research', 'publication' ] all_article_links = article_soup.find_all('a', href=True) for research_link in all_article_links: href = research_link.get('href', '').lower() text = research_link.get_text().strip() # Check if this looks like a research paper link if any(indicator in href or indicator in text.lower() for indicator in research_indicators): research_links.append({ 'url': research_link.get('href'), 'text': text, 'full_text': research_link.get_text().strip() }) print(f" Found {len(research_links)} potential research paper links") # Show the research links if research_links: print(f"\n üî¨ RESEARCH PAPER LINKS FOUND:") for j, rlink in enumerate(research_links, 1): print(f" {j}. {rlink['text'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {rlink['url']}") accessed_articles.append({ 'url': link['url'], 'title': article_title, 'filename': article_filename, 'author_confirmed': author_in_article, 'date_confirmed': date_in_article, 'research_links': research_links, 'research_links_count': len(research_links) }) else: print(f" Not the target article (author: {author_in_article}, date: {date_in_article})") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed to access (Status: {article_response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Exception: {str(e)}") time.sleep(1) # Be respectful to the server # Save results search_results = { 'search_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'strategy': 'Fixed direct web scraping of Universe Today website', 'target_author': 'Carolyn Collins Petersen', 'target_site': 'Universe Today', 'target_date': 'June 6, 2023', 'objective': 'Find specific article and identify linked research paper', 'author_references_in_main': len(found_author_refs), 'total_article_links': len(article_links), 'relevant_article_links': len(relevant_links), 'articles_accessed': len(accessed_articles), 'accessed_articles_details': accessed_articles } results_filename = 'workspace/universe_today_fixed_search_results.json' with open(results_filename, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Author references in main page: {len(found_author_refs)}") print(f"Total article links found: {len(article_links)}") print(f"Relevant article links: {len(relevant_links)}") print(f"Articles accessed and analyzed: {len(accessed_articles)}") print(f"Results saved to: {results_filename}") if accessed_articles: print(f"\nüéØ TARGET ARTICLE CANDIDATES FOUND:") for i, article in enumerate(accessed_articles, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Author confirmed: {article['author_confirmed']}") print(f" Date confirmed: {article['date_confirmed']}") print(f" Research links found: {article['research_links_count']}") print(f" Saved to: {article['filename']}") if article['research_links']: print(f" üî¨ RESEARCH PAPER LINKS:") for j, rlink in enumerate(article['research_links'][:3], 1): print(f" {j}. {rlink['text'][:60]}...") print(f" {rlink['url']}") print(f"\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found {len(accessed_articles)} potential target article(s) with research links!") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No target articles found yet") print(f"Will try alternative approaches...") # Try accessing Universe Today's archive page for June 2023 print(f"\n=== TRYING ALTERNATIVE: JUNE 2023 ARCHIVE ===\n") archive_urls = [ 'https://www.universetoday.com/2023/06/', 'https://www.universetoday.com/2023/06/06/', 'https://www.universetoday.com/author/carolyn-collins-petersen/' ] for archive_url in archive_urls: print(f"\nTrying archive URL: {archive_url}") try: archive_response = requests.get(archive_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if archive_response.status_code == 200: print(f" ‚úì Successfully accessed archive (Status: {archive_response.status_code})") # Save archive content archive_filename = f"workspace/archive_{archive_url.replace('https://', '').replace('/', '_')}.html" with open(archive_filename, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(archive_response.text) print(f" Archive content saved to: {archive_filename}") # Quick check for Carolyn Collins Petersen if 'carolyn collins petersen' in archive_response.text.lower(): print(f" ‚òÖ Author found in archive!") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed to access archive (Status: {archive_response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Exception accessing archive: {str(e)}") time.sleep(1) else: print(f"‚úó Failed to re-access main page (Status: {response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f"‚úó Exception re-accessing main page: {str(e)}") else: print("\n‚ö†Ô∏è No existing main page content found") print("Will need to access Universe Today directly...") print(f"\n=== FINAL WORKSPACE STATUS ===\n") final_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Total files in workspace: {len(final_files)}") for file in final_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") print(f"\n=== NEXT STEPS ===\n") print("1. Review any target articles found for the specific research paper link") print("2. Examine archive content if no direct articles were found") print("3. Look for the research paper mentioned at the bottom of the June 6, 2023 article")
Execution Output

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Partial success - Code executed without major crashes and successfully accessed the Universe Today main page, finding 6 author references for Carolyn Collins Petersen. However, the search strategy has significant limitations: (1) No article links with 2023 dates were found using the current filtering approach, (2) Archive URLs returned 404 errors, indicating the site structure may not support date-based navigation, (3) The code found author references but they appear to be from 2025 articles rather than June 2023. **PLAN** alignment: 30% - successfully accessed Universe Today and confirmed Carolyn Collins Petersen publishes there, but failed to locate the specific June 6, 2023 article. The code saved valuable content to workspace files for manual analysis. Recommended next steps: (1) Parse the saved main page content more thoroughly to extract all article URLs regardless of date filtering, (2) Try accessing individual article pages found on the main page to check their actual publication dates, (3) Consider that the target article might be archived or use a different URL structure than expected.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json from datetime import datetime import re import time print("=== FIXED DIRECT WEB SCRAPING FOR UNIVERSE TODAY ARTICLE ===\n") print("Objective: Find Carolyn Collins Petersen article from June 6, 2023 via direct web access\n") # Create workspace directory if needed if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("Created workspace directory") # First, let's check what we already have in workspace print("=== INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE CONTENT ===\n") workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Existing files in workspace: {len(workspace_files)}") for file in workspace_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Check if we already have the main page content main_page_file = None for file in workspace_files: if 'Universe_Today_Main_Page' in file: main_page_file = file break if main_page_file: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING EXISTING MAIN PAGE CONTENT ===\n") print(f"Found existing main page file: {main_page_file}") main_page_path = os.path.join('workspace', main_page_file) with open(main_page_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: main_page_content = f.read() print(f"Content length: {len(main_page_content):,} characters") # Extract the actual content (skip the header) content_start = main_page_content.find('=' * 50) if content_start != -1: actual_content = main_page_content[content_start + 50:] else: actual_content = main_page_content print(f"Actual content length: {len(actual_content):,} characters") # Search for Carolyn Collins Petersen references and article links print("\n=== SEARCHING FOR AUTHOR AND ARTICLE REFERENCES ===\n") # Look for author references author_patterns = [ r'carolyn collins petersen', r'carolyn petersen', r'c\. petersen', r'by carolyn' ] found_author_refs = [] content_lower = actual_content.lower() for pattern in author_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, content_lower)) if matches: for match in matches: # Get context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 150) end = min(len(actual_content), match.end() + 150) context = actual_content[start:end] found_author_refs.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'match': match.group(), 'position': match.start(), 'context': context.replace('\n', ' ').strip() }) print(f"Author references found: {len(found_author_refs)}") # Show author references with context for i, ref in enumerate(found_author_refs, 1): print(f"\n{i}. Author reference: '{ref['match']}' at position {ref['position']:,}") print(f" Context: ...{ref['context'][:200]}...") # Look for article URLs or links that might contain the target article print(f"\n=== EXTRACTING ARTICLE URLS FROM MAIN PAGE ===\n") # Parse the original HTML to get proper links # We need to re-fetch or find the HTML version print("Re-accessing main page to get proper HTML structure...") headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } try: response = requests.get('https://www.universetoday.com', headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úì Successfully re-accessed main page (Status: {response.status_code})") # Parse the HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for article links print("\n=== EXTRACTING ARTICLE LINKS ===\n") # Find all links that might be articles all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) article_links = [] for link in all_links: href = link.get('href', '') text = link.get_text().strip() # Check if this looks like a Universe Today article link if href and text and len(text) > 10: # Look for links that might be articles (contain year/date or are long enough) if (('2023' in href or '/2023/' in href) and (href.startswith('/') or 'universetoday.com' in href)): full_url = href if href.startswith('http') else f"https://www.universetoday.com{href}" # Check if the link text or URL contains relevant keywords relevant_keywords = ['carolyn', 'june', '2023', 'petersen'] is_relevant = any(keyword in text.lower() or keyword in href.lower() for keyword in relevant_keywords) article_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': text[:100], 'href': href, 'is_relevant': is_relevant }) print(f"Total article links found: {len(article_links)}") # Prioritize relevant links relevant_links = [link for link in article_links if link['is_relevant']] print(f"Relevant article links: {len(relevant_links)}") # Show relevant links if relevant_links: print(f"\nRelevant article links found:") for i, link in enumerate(relevant_links[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f"\n{i}. {link['text'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {link['url']}") print(f" Relevant: {link['is_relevant']}") # Try accessing the most promising links print(f"\n=== ACCESSING PROMISING ARTICLE LINKS ===\n") accessed_articles = [] links_to_try = relevant_links[:5] if relevant_links else article_links[:5] for i, link in enumerate(links_to_try, 1): print(f"\nAccessing article {i}: {link['text'][:60]}...") print(f"URL: {link['url']}") try: article_response = requests.get(link['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if article_response.status_code == 200: print(f" ‚úì Successfully accessed (Status: {article_response.status_code})") # Parse the article content article_soup = BeautifulSoup(article_response.text, 'html.parser') # Extract article title title_selectors = ['h1', '.entry-title', '.post-title', 'title'] article_title = 'No title found' for selector in title_selectors: title_element = article_soup.select_one(selector) if title_element: article_title = title_element.get_text().strip() break print(f" Title: {article_title}") # Get article text content article_text = article_soup.get_text().lower() # Check for author in the article author_in_article = 'carolyn collins petersen' in article_text print(f" Author found: {author_in_article}") # Check for June 6, 2023 date date_patterns = ['june 6, 2023', 'june 6 2023', '2023-06-06', 'june 6th, 2023'] date_in_article = any(date_pattern in article_text for date_pattern in date_patterns) print(f" Target date found: {date_in_article}") # If this looks like our target article, save it and look for research paper links if author_in_article and ('june' in article_text or date_in_article): print(f" ‚òÖ POTENTIAL TARGET ARTICLE FOUND!") # Save the full article safe_filename = link['url'].replace('https://', '').replace('http://', '').replace('/', '_').replace(':', '_').replace('?', '_').replace('&', '_') article_filename = f'workspace/target_article_{safe_filename}.html' with open(article_filename, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(article_response.text) print(f" ‚úì Article saved to: {article_filename}") # Look for research paper links print(f" Searching for research paper links...") # Find all links that might be research papers research_links = [] research_indicators = [ 'arxiv.org', 'doi.org', 'nature.com', 'science.org', 'iopscience.iop.org', 'academic.oup.com', 'journals.', 'adsabs.harvard.edu', 'paper', 'study', 'research', 'publication' ] all_article_links = article_soup.find_all('a', href=True) for research_link in all_article_links: href = research_link.get('href', '').lower() text = research_link.get_text().strip() # Check if this looks like a research paper link if any(indicator in href or indicator in text.lower() for indicator in research_indicators): research_links.append({ 'url': research_link.get('href'), 'text': text, 'full_text': research_link.get_text().strip() }) print(f" Found {len(research_links)} potential research paper links") # Show the research links if research_links: print(f"\n üî¨ RESEARCH PAPER LINKS FOUND:") for j, rlink in enumerate(research_links, 1): print(f" {j}. {rlink['text'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {rlink['url']}") accessed_articles.append({ 'url': link['url'], 'title': article_title, 'filename': article_filename, 'author_confirmed': author_in_article, 'date_confirmed': date_in_article, 'research_links': research_links, 'research_links_count': len(research_links) }) else: print(f" Not the target article (author: {author_in_article}, date: {date_in_article})") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed to access (Status: {article_response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Exception: {str(e)}") time.sleep(1) # Be respectful to the server # Save results search_results = { 'search_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'strategy': 'Fixed direct web scraping of Universe Today website', 'target_author': 'Carolyn Collins Petersen', 'target_site': 'Universe Today', 'target_date': 'June 6, 2023', 'objective': 'Find specific article and identify linked research paper', 'author_references_in_main': len(found_author_refs), 'total_article_links': len(article_links), 'relevant_article_links': len(relevant_links), 'articles_accessed': len(accessed_articles), 'accessed_articles_details': accessed_articles } results_filename = 'workspace/universe_today_fixed_search_results.json' with open(results_filename, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Author references in main page: {len(found_author_refs)}") print(f"Total article links found: {len(article_links)}") print(f"Relevant article links: {len(relevant_links)}") print(f"Articles accessed and analyzed: {len(accessed_articles)}") print(f"Results saved to: {results_filename}") if accessed_articles: print(f"\nüéØ TARGET ARTICLE CANDIDATES FOUND:") for i, article in enumerate(accessed_articles, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Author confirmed: {article['author_confirmed']}") print(f" Date confirmed: {article['date_confirmed']}") print(f" Research links found: {article['research_links_count']}") print(f" Saved to: {article['filename']}") if article['research_links']: print(f" üî¨ RESEARCH PAPER LINKS:") for j, rlink in enumerate(article['research_links'][:3], 1): print(f" {j}. {rlink['text'][:60]}...") print(f" {rlink['url']}") print(f"\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found {len(accessed_articles)} potential target article(s) with research links!") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No target articles found yet") print(f"Will try alternative approaches...") # Try accessing Universe Today's archive page for June 2023 print(f"\n=== TRYING ALTERNATIVE: JUNE 2023 ARCHIVE ===\n") archive_urls = [ 'https://www.universetoday.com/2023/06/', 'https://www.universetoday.com/2023/06/06/', 'https://www.universetoday.com/author/carolyn-collins-petersen/' ] for archive_url in archive_urls: print(f"\nTrying archive URL: {archive_url}") try: archive_response = requests.get(archive_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if archive_response.status_code == 200: print(f" ‚úì Successfully accessed archive (Status: {archive_response.status_code})") # Save archive content archive_filename = f"workspace/archive_{archive_url.replace('https://', '').replace('/', '_')}.html" with open(archive_filename, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(archive_response.text) print(f" Archive content saved to: {archive_filename}") # Quick check for Carolyn Collins Petersen if 'carolyn collins petersen' in archive_response.text.lower(): print(f" ‚òÖ Author found in archive!") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed to access archive (Status: {archive_response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Exception accessing archive: {str(e)}") time.sleep(1) else: print(f"‚úó Failed to re-access main page (Status: {response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f"‚úó Exception re-accessing main page: {str(e)}") else: print("\n‚ö†Ô∏è No existing main page content found") print("Will need to access Universe Today directly...") print(f"\n=== FINAL WORKSPACE STATUS ===\n") final_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Total files in workspace: {len(final_files)}") for file in final_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") print(f"\n=== NEXT STEPS ===\n") print("1. Review any target articles found for the specific research paper link") print("2. Examine archive content if no direct articles were found") print("3. Look for the research paper mentioned at the bottom of the June 6, 2023 article")
Execution Output
Code Output: === FIXED DIRECT WEB SCRAPING FOR UNIVERSE TODAY ARTICLE === Objective: Find Carolyn Collins Petersen article from June 6, 2023 via direct web access === INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE CONTENT === Existing files in workspace: 2 - universe_today_search_results.json (942 bytes) - universe_today_direct_1_Universe_Today_Main_Page.txt (29,070 bytes) === ANALYZING EXISTING MAIN PAGE CONTENT === Found existing main page file: universe_today_direct_1_Universe_Today_Main_Page.txt Content length: 28,947 characters Actual content length: 28,733 characters === SEARCHING FOR AUTHOR AND ARTICLE REFERENCES === Author references found: 6 1.
