Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print("=== PARSING EXISTING UNIVERSE TODAY CONTENT FOR TARGET ARTICLE ===\n") print("Objective: Find Carolyn Collins Petersen article from June 6, 2023 and extract research paper link\n") # First, let's inspect the workspace to understand what HTML content we have print("=== WORKSPACE INSPECTION ===\n") workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Current workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}") # Look for HTML files that contain Universe Today content html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"\nHTML files found: {len(html_files)}") for file in html_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Use the most recent/largest HTML file if html_files: # Sort by file size to get the most comprehensive content html_files_with_size = [(f, os.path.getsize(os.path.join('workspace', f))) for f in html_files] html_files_with_size.sort(key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) target_html_file = html_files_with_size[0][0] print(f"\n=== ANALYZING HTML CONTENT: {target_html_file} ===\n") # Read and parse the HTML content html_path = os.path.join('workspace', target_html_file) with open(html_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f"HTML content length: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Extract all article links from the HTML print("\n=== EXTRACTING ALL ARTICLE LINKS ===\n") all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) print(f"Total links found: {len(all_links)}") # Filter for article links - fix the variable scope issue article_links = [] author_links = [] for link in all_links: href_attr = link.get('href', '') link_text = link.get_text().strip() if href_attr and link_text and len(link_text) > 10: # Make URL absolute if href_attr.startswith('/'): full_url = f"https://www.universetoday.com{href_attr}" elif href_attr.startswith('http'): full_url = href_attr else: continue # Categorize links - use properly defined variables link_text_lower = link_text.lower() href_lower = href_attr.lower() # Look for Carolyn Collins Petersen references if ('carolyn' in link_text_lower or 'carolyn' in href_lower or 'petersen' in link_text_lower or 'petersen' in href_lower): author_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': link_text, 'href': href_attr, 'type': 'author_related' }) # Look for article links (containing dates or space-related keywords) elif (any(year in href_attr for year in ['2023', '2022', '2024']) or any(keyword in link_text_lower for keyword in ['space', 'star', 'planet', 'astronomy', 'telescope', 'galaxy'])): article_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': link_text, 'href': href_attr, 'type': 'article' }) print(f"Article links found: {len(article_links)}") print(f"Author-related links found: {len(author_links)}") # Show author-related links if author_links: print(f"\nüìù AUTHOR-RELATED LINKS:") for i, link in enumerate(author_links[:10], 1): print(f" {i}. {link['text'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {link['url']}") # Look for the author page specifically author_page_candidates = [] for link in author_links: if '/author/' in link['href'] and 'carolyn' in link['href'].lower(): author_page_candidates.append(link) if not author_page_candidates: # Try to construct the author page URL author_page_url = 'https://www.universetoday.com/author/carolyn-collins-petersen/' author_page_candidates = [{ 'url': author_page_url, 'text': 'Carolyn Collins Petersen Author Page (constructed)', 'href': '/author/carolyn-collins-petersen/', 'type': 'constructed' }] print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR JUNE 6, 2023 ARTICLE REFERENCES ===\n") # Search the current HTML content for any June 6, 2023 references june_6_patterns = [ r'june 6,? 2023', r'june 6th,? 2023', r'6 june 2023', r'2023-06-06', r'06/06/2023' ] found_date_refs = [] html_text_lower = html_content.lower() for pattern in june_6_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, html_text_lower)) if matches: for match in matches: # Get context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 200) end = min(len(html_content), match.end() + 200) context = html_content[start:end] found_date_refs.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'match': match.group(), 'position': match.start(), 'context': context.replace('\n', ' ').strip() }) print(f"June 6, 2023 references found in current HTML: {len(found_date_refs)}") if found_date_refs: print(f"\nüéØ JUNE 6, 2023 REFERENCES FOUND IN CURRENT PAGE:") for i, ref in enumerate(found_date_refs, 1): print(f" {i}. Pattern: {ref['pattern']}") print(f" Match: {ref['match']}") print(f" Context: ...{ref['context'][:150]}...") # Save the extracted links for analysis links_analysis = { 'extraction_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'source_file': target_html_file, 'total_links': len(all_links), 'article_links_count': len(article_links), 'author_links_count': len(author_links), 'june_6_2023_refs': len(found_date_refs), 'author_links': author_links, 'article_links': article_links[:20], # Save first 20 article links 'june_6_refs': found_date_refs, 'author_page_candidates': author_page_candidates } analysis_file = 'workspace/universe_today_links_analysis.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(links_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\nLinks analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") # If no direct references found, we need to access the author page print(f"\n=== ACCESSING CAROLYN COLLINS PETERSEN AUTHOR PAGE ===\n") import requests import time headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } target_articles = [] for author_candidate in author_page_candidates[:1]: # Try first candidate print(f"Accessing author page: {author_candidate['url']}") try: response = requests.get(author_candidate['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úì Successfully accessed author page (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") # Parse author page author_soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Save author page author_page_file = 'workspace/carolyn_petersen_author_page.html' with open(author_page_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f"Author page saved to: {author_page_file}") # Search for June 2023 articles on the author page print(f"\nSearching author page for June 2023 articles...") author_page_text = response.text.lower() # Look for June 6, 2023 specifically june_6_found = False for pattern in june_6_patterns: if re.search(pattern, author_page_text): june_6_found = True print(f"‚òÖ Found June 6, 2023 reference on author page!") break # Extract article links from author page author_article_links = [] author_all_links = author_soup.find_all('a', href=True) for link in author_all_links: link_href = link.get('href', '') link_text = link.get_text().strip() # Look for article links if (link_href and link_text and len(link_text) > 20 and ('2023' in link_href or '2023' in link_text) and ('universetoday.com' in link_href or link_href.startswith('/'))): full_url = link_href if link_href.startswith('http') else f"https://www.universetoday.com{link_href}" author_article_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': link_text, 'href': link_href }) print(f"Found {len(author_article_links)} article links on author page") # Check each article for June 6, 2023 date for i, article_link in enumerate(author_article_links[:10], 1): # Check first 10 print(f"\n Checking article {i}: {article_link['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {article_link['url']}") try: article_response = requests.get(article_link['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if article_response.status_code == 200: article_text_lower = article_response.text.lower() # Check for June 6, 2023 is_june_6 = any(re.search(pattern, article_text_lower) for pattern in june_6_patterns) if is_june_6: print(f" ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ FOUND TARGET ARTICLE! June 6, 2023 confirmed ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ") # Parse article for research links article_soup = BeautifulSoup(article_response.text, 'html.parser') # Save target article safe_filename = article_link['url'].replace('https://', '').replace('/', '_').replace(':', '_') target_file = f'workspace/target_article_june_6_2023_{safe_filename}.html' with open(target_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(article_response.text) print(f" ‚úì Target article saved to: {target_file}") # Extract research paper links research_links = [] research_indicators = [ 'arxiv.org', 'doi.org', 'nature.com', 'science.org', 'iopscience.iop.org', 'academic.oup.com', 'journals.', 'adsabs.harvard.edu', 'paper', 'study', 'research', 'publication', 'journal', 'proceedings' ] all_article_links = article_soup.find_all('a', href=True) for rlink in all_article_links: rlink_href = rlink.get('href', '') rlink_text = rlink.get_text().strip() if any(indicator in rlink_href.lower() or indicator in rlink_text.lower() for indicator in research_indicators): research_links.append({ 'url': rlink_href, 'text': rlink_text, 'context': str(rlink.parent)[:200] if rlink.parent else 'N/A' }) print(f" Found {len(research_links)} research paper links") if research_links: print(f"\n üî¨ RESEARCH PAPER LINKS FOUND:") for j, rlink in enumerate(research_links, 1): print(f" {j}. Text: {rlink['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {rlink['url']}") target_articles.append({ 'url': article_link['url'], 'title': article_link['text'], 'filename': target_file, 'research_links': research_links, 'research_count': len(research_links) }) else: print(f" Not June 6, 2023 - continuing search") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed to access (Status: {article_response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Exception: {str(e)}") time.sleep(1) # Be respectful else: print(f"‚úó Failed to access author page (Status: {response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f"‚úó Exception accessing author page: {str(e)}") # Save final results final_results = { 'search_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find Carolyn Collins Petersen June 6, 2023 Universe Today article', 'html_source_analyzed': target_html_file, 'links_extracted': len(article_links) + len(author_links), 'author_page_accessed': len(author_page_candidates) > 0, 'target_articles_found': len(target_articles), 'target_articles': target_articles } results_file = 'workspace/universe_today_final_search_results.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== FINAL RESULTS ===\n") print(f"HTML source analyzed: {target_html_file}") print(f"Links extracted: {len(article_links) + len(author_links)}") print(f"Target articles found: {len(target_articles)}") print(f"Results saved to: {results_file}") if target_articles: print(f"\nüéØ SUCCESS! TARGET ARTICLE(S) FOUND:") for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Saved to: {article['filename']}") print(f" Research links: {article['research_count']}") if article['research_links']: print(f" üìã RESEARCH PAPER LINKS:") for j, rlink in enumerate(article['research_links'], 1): print(f" {j}. {rlink['text'][:50]}...") print(f" {rlink['url']}") print(f"\n‚úÖ PLAN COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY!") print(f"- Found Carolyn Collins Petersen Universe Today article from June 6, 2023") print(f"- Extracted research paper links from the article") print(f"- All content saved to workspace for analysis") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No June 6, 2023 articles found") print(f"Author page analysis completed but no exact date match found") else: print("\n‚ö†Ô∏è No HTML files found in workspace") print("Need to access Universe Today directly first") print(f"\n=== FINAL WORKSPACE STATUS ===\n") final_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Total files: {len(final_files)}") for file in sorted(final_files): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code crashed with a NameError: name 'href' is not defined during the article link processing section. While the code successfully accessed Universe Today main page (Status 200, 73,524 bytes) and saved the HTML content to workspace, it failed when trying to extract article links due to an undefined variable scope issue. The error occurred in a generator expression where 'href' was referenced but not properly defined in the local scope. **PLAN** alignment: 25% - partial progress made by successfully accessing Universe Today and saving the main page HTML, but unable to complete the core objective of finding the June 6, 2023 article due to the variable error. The workspace now contains the raw HTML file which could be manually parsed. Recommended fix: Define 'href' variable properly in the link processing loop before using it in the generator expression, likely by ensuring 'link.get('href', '')' is assigned to a local variable before the filtering logic.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print("=== PARSING EXISTING UNIVERSE TODAY CONTENT FOR TARGET ARTICLE ===\n") print("Objective: Find Carolyn Collins Petersen article from June 6, 2023 and extract research paper link\n") # First, let's inspect the workspace to understand what HTML content we have print("=== WORKSPACE INSPECTION ===\n") workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Current workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}") # Look for HTML files that contain Universe Today content html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"\nHTML files found: {len(html_files)}") for file in html_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Use the most recent/largest HTML file if html_files: # Sort by file size to get the most comprehensive content html_files_with_size = [(f, os.path.getsize(os.path.join('workspace', f))) for f in html_files] html_files_with_size.sort(key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) target_html_file = html_files_with_size[0][0] print(f"\n=== ANALYZING HTML CONTENT: {target_html_file} ===\n") # Read and parse the HTML content html_path = os.path.join('workspace', target_html_file) with open(html_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f"HTML content length: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Extract all article links from the HTML print("\n=== EXTRACTING ALL ARTICLE LINKS ===\n") all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) print(f"Total links found: {len(all_links)}") # Filter for article links - fix the variable scope issue article_links = [] author_links = [] for link in all_links: href_attr = link.get('href', '') link_text = link.get_text().strip() if href_attr and link_text and len(link_text) > 10: # Make URL absolute if href_attr.startswith('/'): full_url = f"https://www.universetoday.com{href_attr}" elif href_attr.startswith('http'): full_url = href_attr else: continue # Categorize links - use properly defined variables link_text_lower = link_text.lower() href_lower = href_attr.lower() # Look for Carolyn Collins Petersen references if ('carolyn' in link_text_lower or 'carolyn' in href_lower or 'petersen' in link_text_lower or 'petersen' in href_lower): author_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': link_text, 'href': href_attr, 'type': 'author_related' }) # Look for article links (containing dates or space-related keywords) elif (any(year in href_attr for year in ['2023', '2022', '2024']) or any(keyword in link_text_lower for keyword in ['space', 'star', 'planet', 'astronomy', 'telescope', 'galaxy'])): article_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': link_text, 'href': href_attr, 'type': 'article' }) print(f"Article links found: {len(article_links)}") print(f"Author-related links found: {len(author_links)}") # Show author-related links if author_links: print(f"\nüìù AUTHOR-RELATED LINKS:") for i, link in enumerate(author_links[:10], 1): print(f" {i}. {link['text'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {link['url']}") # Look for the author page specifically author_page_candidates = [] for link in author_links: if '/author/' in link['href'] and 'carolyn' in link['href'].lower(): author_page_candidates.append(link) if not author_page_candidates: # Try to construct the author page URL author_page_url = 'https://www.universetoday.com/author/carolyn-collins-petersen/' author_page_candidates = [{ 'url': author_page_url, 'text': 'Carolyn Collins Petersen Author Page (constructed)', 'href': '/author/carolyn-collins-petersen/', 'type': 'constructed' }] print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR JUNE 6, 2023 ARTICLE REFERENCES ===\n") # Search the current HTML content for any June 6, 2023 references june_6_patterns = [ r'june 6,? 2023', r'june 6th,? 2023', r'6 june 2023', r'2023-06-06', r'06/06/2023' ] found_date_refs = [] html_text_lower = html_content.lower() for pattern in june_6_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, html_text_lower)) if matches: for match in matches: # Get context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 200) end = min(len(html_content), match.end() + 200) context = html_content[start:end] found_date_refs.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'match': match.group(), 'position': match.start(), 'context': context.replace('\n', ' ').strip() }) print(f"June 6, 2023 references found in current HTML: {len(found_date_refs)}") if found_date_refs: print(f"\nüéØ JUNE 6, 2023 REFERENCES FOUND IN CURRENT PAGE:") for i, ref in enumerate(found_date_refs, 1): print(f" {i}. Pattern: {ref['pattern']}") print(f" Match: {ref['match']}") print(f" Context: ...{ref['context'][:150]}...") # Save the extracted links for analysis links_analysis = { 'extraction_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'source_file': target_html_file, 'total_links': len(all_links), 'article_links_count': len(article_links), 'author_links_count': len(author_links), 'june_6_2023_refs': len(found_date_refs), 'author_links': author_links, 'article_links': article_links[:20], # Save first 20 article links 'june_6_refs': found_date_refs, 'author_page_candidates': author_page_candidates } analysis_file = 'workspace/universe_today_links_analysis.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(links_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\nLinks analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") # If no direct references found, we need to access the author page print(f"\n=== ACCESSING CAROLYN COLLINS PETERSEN AUTHOR PAGE ===\n") import requests import time headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } target_articles = [] for author_candidate in author_page_candidates[:1]: # Try first candidate print(f"Accessing author page: {author_candidate['url']}") try: response = requests.get(author_candidate['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úì Successfully accessed author page (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") # Parse author page author_soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Save author page author_page_file = 'workspace/carolyn_petersen_author_page.html' with open(author_page_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f"Author page saved to: {author_page_file}") # Search for June 2023 articles on the author page print(f"\nSearching author page for June 2023 articles...") author_page_text = response.text.lower() # Look for June 6, 2023 specifically june_6_found = False for pattern in june_6_patterns: if re.search(pattern, author_page_text): june_6_found = True print(f"‚òÖ Found June 6, 2023 reference on author page!") break # Extract article links from author page author_article_links = [] author_all_links = author_soup.find_all('a', href=True) for link in author_all_links: link_href = link.get('href', '') link_text = link.get_text().strip() # Look for article links if (link_href and link_text and len(link_text) > 20 and ('2023' in link_href or '2023' in link_text) and ('universetoday.com' in link_href or link_href.startswith('/'))): full_url = link_href if link_href.startswith('http') else f"https://www.universetoday.com{link_href}" author_article_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': link_text, 'href': link_href }) print(f"Found {len(author_article_links)} article links on author page") # Check each article for June 6, 2023 date for i, article_link in enumerate(author_article_links[:10], 1): # Check first 10 print(f"\n Checking article {i}: {article_link['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {article_link['url']}") try: article_response = requests.get(article_link['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if article_response.status_code == 200: article_text_lower = article_response.text.lower() # Check for June 6, 2023 is_june_6 = any(re.search(pattern, article_text_lower) for pattern in june_6_patterns) if is_june_6: print(f" ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ FOUND TARGET ARTICLE! June 6, 2023 confirmed ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ") # Parse article for research links article_soup = BeautifulSoup(article_response.text, 'html.parser') # Save target article safe_filename = article_link['url'].replace('https://', '').replace('/', '_').replace(':', '_') target_file = f'workspace/target_article_june_6_2023_{safe_filename}.html' with open(target_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(article_response.text) print(f" ‚úì Target article saved to: {target_file}") # Extract research paper links research_links = [] research_indicators = [ 'arxiv.org', 'doi.org', 'nature.com', 'science.org', 'iopscience.iop.org', 'academic.oup.com', 'journals.', 'adsabs.harvard.edu', 'paper', 'study', 'research', 'publication', 'journal', 'proceedings' ] all_article_links = article_soup.find_all('a', href=True) for rlink in all_article_links: rlink_href = rlink.get('href', '') rlink_text = rlink.get_text().strip() if any(indicator in rlink_href.lower() or indicator in rlink_text.lower() for indicator in research_indicators): research_links.append({ 'url': rlink_href, 'text': rlink_text, 'context': str(rlink.parent)[:200] if rlink.parent else 'N/A' }) print(f" Found {len(research_links)} research paper links") if research_links: print(f"\n üî¨ RESEARCH PAPER LINKS FOUND:") for j, rlink in enumerate(research_links, 1): print(f" {j}. Text: {rlink['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {rlink['url']}") target_articles.append({ 'url': article_link['url'], 'title': article_link['text'], 'filename': target_file, 'research_links': research_links, 'research_count': len(research_links) }) else: print(f" Not June 6, 2023 - continuing search") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed to access (Status: {article_response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Exception: {str(e)}") time.sleep(1) # Be respectful else: print(f"‚úó Failed to access author page (Status: {response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f"‚úó Exception accessing author page: {str(e)}") # Save final results final_results = { 'search_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find Carolyn Collins Petersen June 6, 2023 Universe Today article', 'html_source_analyzed': target_html_file, 'links_extracted': len(article_links) + len(author_links), 'author_page_accessed': len(author_page_candidates) > 0, 'target_articles_found': len(target_articles), 'target_articles': target_articles } results_file = 'workspace/universe_today_final_search_results.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== FINAL RESULTS ===\n") print(f"HTML source analyzed: {target_html_file}") print(f"Links extracted: {len(article_links) + len(author_links)}") print(f"Target articles found: {len(target_articles)}") print(f"Results saved to: {results_file}") if target_articles: print(f"\nüéØ SUCCESS! TARGET ARTICLE(S) FOUND:") for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Saved to: {article['filename']}") print(f" Research links: {article['research_count']}") if article['research_links']: print(f" üìã RESEARCH PAPER LINKS:") for j, rlink in enumerate(article['research_links'], 1): print(f" {j}. {rlink['text'][:50]}...") print(f" {rlink['url']}") print(f"\n‚úÖ PLAN COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY!") print(f"- Found Carolyn Collins Petersen Universe Today article from June 6, 2023") print(f"- Extracted research paper links from the article") print(f"- All content saved to workspace for analysis") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No June 6, 2023 articles found") print(f"Author page analysis completed but no exact date match found") else: print("\n‚ö†Ô∏è No HTML files found in workspace") print("Need to access Universe Today directly first") print(f"\n=== FINAL WORKSPACE STATUS ===\n") final_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Total files: {len(final_files)}") for file in sorted(final_files): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")

Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 8)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print("=== UNIVERSE TODAY ARTICLE SEARCH - FIXED APPROACH ===\n") print("Objective: Find Carolyn Collins Petersen article from June 6, 2023 and extract research paper link\n") # First, let's inspect the workspace to understand what we have print("=== WORKSPACE INSPECTION ===\n") workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Current workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}") for file in workspace_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Look for HTML files that contain Universe Today content html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"\nHTML files found: {len(html_files)}") if html_files: # Use the largest HTML file (most comprehensive content) html_files_with_size = [(f, os.path.getsize(os.path.join('workspace', f))) for f in html_files] html_files_with_size.sort(key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) target_html_file = html_files_with_size[0][0] print(f"\n=== ANALYZING HTML CONTENT: {target_html_file} ===\n") # Read and parse the HTML content html_path = os.path.join('workspace', target_html_file) with open(html_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f"HTML content length: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') print("\n=== EXTRACTING ARTICLE LINKS (FIXED APPROACH) ===\n") all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) print(f"Total links found: {len(all_links)}") # Process links carefully to avoid variable scope issues article_links = [] author_links = [] for i, link in enumerate(all_links): # Get link attributes safely href_value = link.get('href', '') text_value = link.get_text().strip() # Skip empty or very short links if not href_value or not text_value or len(text_value) < 10: continue # Make URL absolute if href_value.startswith('/'): full_url = f"https://www.universetoday.com{href_value}" elif href_value.startswith('http'): full_url = href_value else: continue # Convert to lowercase for comparison text_lower = text_value.lower() href_lower = href_value.lower() # Look for Carolyn Collins Petersen references is_author_related = False if ('carolyn' in text_lower or 'carolyn' in href_lower or 'petersen' in text_lower or 'petersen' in href_lower): is_author_related = True author_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': text_value, 'href': href_value, 'type': 'author_related' }) # Look for article links (containing dates or space-related keywords) is_article_link = False year_in_href = any(year in href_value for year in ['2023', '2022', '2024']) space_keywords = ['space', 'star', 'planet', 'astronomy', 'telescope', 'galaxy'] space_in_text = any(keyword in text_lower for keyword in space_keywords) if year_in_href or space_in_text: is_article_link = True article_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': text_value, 'href': href_value, 'type': 'article' }) # Progress indicator if (i + 1) % 50 == 0: print(f" Processed {i + 1}/{len(all_links)} links...") print(f"\nLink extraction complete:") print(f" - Article links found: {len(article_links)}") print(f" - Author-related links found: {len(author_links)}") # Show author-related links if found if author_links: print(f"\nüìù AUTHOR-RELATED LINKS FOUND:") for i, link in enumerate(author_links[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. {link['text'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {link['url']}") # Search for June 6, 2023 references in the current HTML print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR JUNE 6, 2023 REFERENCES ===\n") june_6_patterns = [ r'june 6,? 2023', r'june 6th,? 2023', r'6 june 2023', r'2023-06-06', r'06/06/2023' ] found_date_refs = [] html_text_lower = html_content.lower() for pattern in june_6_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, html_text_lower)) for match in matches: # Get context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 200) end = min(len(html_content), match.end() + 200) context = html_content[start:end] found_date_refs.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'match': match.group(), 'position': match.start(), 'context': context.replace('\n', ' ').strip() }) print(f"June 6, 2023 references found in current HTML: {len(found_date_refs)}") if found_date_refs: print(f"\nüéØ JUNE 6, 2023 REFERENCES FOUND:") for i, ref in enumerate(found_date_refs, 1): print(f" {i}. Pattern: {ref['pattern']}") print(f" Match: {ref['match']}") print(f" Context: ...{ref['context'][:150]}...") # Prepare author page candidates author_page_candidates = [] for link in author_links: if '/author/' in link['href'] and 'carolyn' in link['href'].lower(): author_page_candidates.append(link) # If no direct author page found, construct one if not author_page_candidates: author_page_url = 'https://www.universetoday.com/author/carolyn-collins-petersen/' author_page_candidates = [{ 'url': author_page_url, 'text': 'Carolyn Collins Petersen Author Page (constructed)', 'href': '/author/carolyn-collins-petersen/', 'type': 'constructed' }] print(f"\nAuthor page candidates: {len(author_page_candidates)}") # Now access the author page to find the specific article print(f"\n=== ACCESSING CAROLYN COLLINS PETERSEN AUTHOR PAGE ===\n") import requests import time headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } target_articles = [] for author_candidate in author_page_candidates[:1]: # Try first candidate print(f"Accessing author page: {author_candidate['url']}") try: response = requests.get(author_candidate['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úì Successfully accessed author page (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") # Parse author page author_soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Save author page author_page_file = 'workspace/carolyn_petersen_author_page.html' with open(author_page_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f"Author page saved to: {author_page_file}") # Extract article links from author page print(f"\nExtracting article links from author page...") author_article_links = [] author_all_links = author_soup.find_all('a', href=True) for link in author_all_links: link_href = link.get('href', '') link_text = link.get_text().strip() # Look for article links with 2023 references if (link_href and link_text and len(link_text) > 20 and ('2023' in link_href or '2023' in link_text) and ('universetoday.com' in link_href or link_href.startswith('/'))): full_url = link_href if link_href.startswith('http') else f"https://www.universetoday.com{link_href}" author_article_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': link_text, 'href': link_href }) print(f"Found {len(author_article_links)} 2023 article links on author page") # Check each article for June 6, 2023 date for i, article_link in enumerate(author_article_links[:8], 1): # Check first 8 print(f"\n Checking article {i}: {article_link['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {article_link['url']}") try: article_response = requests.get(article_link['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if article_response.status_code == 200: article_text_lower = article_response.text.lower() # Check for June 6, 2023 using our patterns is_june_6 = False for pattern in june_6_patterns: if re.search(pattern, article_text_lower): is_june_6 = True break if is_june_6: print(f" ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ FOUND TARGET ARTICLE! June 6, 2023 confirmed ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ") # Parse article for research links article_soup = BeautifulSoup(article_response.text, 'html.parser') # Save target article safe_filename = article_link['url'].replace('https://', '').replace('/', '_').replace(':', '_').replace('?', '_').replace('&', '_') target_file = f'workspace/target_article_june_6_2023_{safe_filename}.html' with open(target_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(article_response.text) print(f" ‚úì Target article saved to: {target_file}") # Extract research paper links print(f" üîç Extracting research paper links...") research_links = [] research_indicators = [ 'arxiv.org', 'doi.org', 'nature.com', 'science.org', 'iopscience.iop.org', 'academic.oup.com', 'journals.', 'adsabs.harvard.edu', 'paper', 'study', 'research', 'publication', 'journal', 'proceedings' ] all_article_links = article_soup.find_all('a', href=True) for rlink in all_article_links: rlink_href = rlink.get('href', '') rlink_text = rlink.get_text().strip() # Check if this looks like a research paper link is_research_link = False for indicator in research_indicators: if indicator in rlink_href.lower() or indicator in rlink_text.lower(): is_research_link = True break if is_research_link: research_links.append({ 'url': rlink_href, 'text': rlink_text, 'context': str(rlink.parent)[:200] if rlink.parent else 'N/A' }) print(f" Found {len(research_links)} research paper links") if research_links: print(f"\n üî¨ RESEARCH PAPER LINKS FOUND:") for j, rlink in enumerate(research_links, 1): print(f" {j}. Text: {rlink['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {rlink['url']}") target_articles.append({ 'url': article_link['url'], 'title': article_link['text'], 'filename': target_file, 'research_links': research_links, 'research_count': len(research_links) }) # Found the target, can break break else: print(f" Not June 6, 2023 - continuing search") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed to access (Status: {article_response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Exception: {str(e)}") time.sleep(1) # Be respectful to the server else: print(f"‚úó Failed to access author page (Status: {response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f"‚úó Exception accessing author page: {str(e)}") # Save final results final_results = { 'search_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find Carolyn Collins Petersen June 6, 2023 Universe Today article', 'html_source_analyzed': target_html_file, 'total_links_processed': len(all_links), 'article_links_found': len(article_links), 'author_links_found': len(author_links), 'june_6_refs_in_main_page': len(found_date_refs), 'target_articles_found': len(target_articles), 'target_articles': target_articles } results_file = 'workspace/universe_today_search_final_results.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== FINAL SEARCH RESULTS ===\n") print(f"HTML source analyzed: {target_html_file}") print(f"Total links processed: {len(all_links)}") print(f"Article links found: {len(article_links)}") print(f"Author links found: {len(author_links)}") print(f"Target articles found: {len(target_articles)}") print(f"Results saved to: {results_file}") if target_articles: print(f"\nüéØ SUCCESS! TARGET ARTICLE(S) FOUND:") for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Saved to: {article['filename']}") print(f" Research links found: {article['research_count']}") if article['research_links']: print(f" üìã RESEARCH PAPER LINKS:") for j, rlink in enumerate(article['research_links'], 1): print(f" {j}. {rlink['text'][:50]}...") print(f" {rlink['url']}") print(f"\n‚úÖ PLAN COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY!") print(f"- Found Carolyn Collins Petersen Universe Today article from June 6, 2023") print(f"- Extracted {sum(a['research_count'] for a in target_articles)} research paper link(s)") print(f"- All content saved to workspace for analysis") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No June 6, 2023 articles found") print(f"Searched author page but no exact date match found") else: print("\n‚ö†Ô∏è No HTML files found in workspace") print("Unable to proceed without Universe Today content") print(f"\n=== FINAL WORKSPACE STATUS ===\n") final_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Total files: {len(final_files)}") for file in sorted(final_files): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")
Execution Output
Code Output: === UNIVERSE TODAY ARTICLE SEARCH - FIXED APPROACH === Objective: Find Carolyn Collins Petersen article from June 6, 2023 and extract research paper link === WORKSPACE INSPECTION === Current workspace files: 5 - universe_today_search_results.json (942 bytes) - universe_today_fixed_search_results.json (455 bytes) - universe_today_main_page_raw.html (73,646 bytes) - universe_today_direct_1_Universe_Today_Main_Page.txt (29,070 bytes) - universe_today_main_page_fresh.html (73,646 bytes) HTML files found: 2 === ANALYZING HTML CONTENT: universe_today_main_page_raw.html === HTML content length: 73,524 characters === EXTRACTING ARTICLE LINKS (FIXED APPROACH) === Total links found: 252 Execution error: NameError: name 'href_value' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/liujiarui.1/Documents/È°πÁõÆ/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code """Python interpreter main class""" ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 85, in <module> File "<string>", line 85, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'href_value' is not defined

Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code crashed again with the same NameError: name 'href_attr' is not defined at line 80, despite attempts to fix the variable scope issue. The error occurs in a generator expression within the article link filtering logic. The code successfully parsed the Universe Today HTML (73,524 characters, 252 total links found) but fails during link categorization. **PLAN** alignment: 30% - made progress by accessing HTML content and beginning link extraction, but cannot complete the core objective due to the persistent variable scope error. The issue appears to be in the list comprehension or generator expression where 'href_attr' is used before being properly defined in the local scope. Recommended fix: Completely rewrite the link filtering section without generator expressions, using simple for loops with properly scoped variables, and ensure all variables (href_attr, link_text, etc.) are defined within the same scope where they are used.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print("=== UNIVERSE TODAY ARTICLE SEARCH - FIXED APPROACH ===\n") print("Objective: Find Carolyn Collins Petersen article from June 6, 2023 and extract research paper link\n") # First, let's inspect the workspace to understand what we have print("=== WORKSPACE INSPECTION ===\n") workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Current workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}") for file in workspace_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Look for HTML files that contain Universe Today content html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"\nHTML files found: {len(html_files)}") if html_files: # Use the largest HTML file (most comprehensive content) html_files_with_size = [(f, os.path.getsize(os.path.join('workspace', f))) for f in html_files] html_files_with_size.sort(key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) target_html_file = html_files_with_size[0][0] print(f"\n=== ANALYZING HTML CONTENT: {target_html_file} ===\n") # Read and parse the HTML content html_path = os.path.join('workspace', target_html_file) with open(html_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f"HTML content length: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') print("\n=== EXTRACTING ARTICLE LINKS (FIXED APPROACH) ===\n") all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) print(f"Total links found: {len(all_links)}") # Process links carefully to avoid variable scope issues article_links = [] author_links = [] for i, link in enumerate(all_links): # Get link attributes safely href_value = link.get('href', '') text_value = link.get_text().strip() # Skip empty or very short links if not href_value or not text_value or len(text_value) < 10: continue # Make URL absolute if href_value.startswith('/'): full_url = f"https://www.universetoday.com{href_value}" elif href_value.startswith('http'): full_url = href_value else: continue # Convert to lowercase for comparison text_lower = text_value.lower() href_lower = href_value.lower() # Look for Carolyn Collins Petersen references is_author_related = False if ('carolyn' in text_lower or 'carolyn' in href_lower or 'petersen' in text_lower or 'petersen' in href_lower): is_author_related = True author_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': text_value, 'href': href_value, 'type': 'author_related' }) # Look for article links (containing dates or space-related keywords) is_article_link = False year_in_href = any(year in href_value for year in ['2023', '2022', '2024']) space_keywords = ['space', 'star', 'planet', 'astronomy', 'telescope', 'galaxy'] space_in_text = any(keyword in text_lower for keyword in space_keywords) if year_in_href or space_in_text: is_article_link = True article_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': text_value, 'href': href_value, 'type': 'article' }) # Progress indicator if (i + 1) % 50 == 0: print(f" Processed {i + 1}/{len(all_links)} links...") print(f"\nLink extraction complete:") print(f" - Article links found: {len(article_links)}") print(f" - Author-related links found: {len(author_links)}") # Show author-related links if found if author_links: print(f"\nüìù AUTHOR-RELATED LINKS FOUND:") for i, link in enumerate(author_links[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. {link['text'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {link['url']}") # Search for June 6, 2023 references in the current HTML print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR JUNE 6, 2023 REFERENCES ===\n") june_6_patterns = [ r'june 6,? 2023', r'june 6th,? 2023', r'6 june 2023', r'2023-06-06', r'06/06/2023' ] found_date_refs = [] html_text_lower = html_content.lower() for pattern in june_6_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, html_text_lower)) for match in matches: # Get context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 200) end = min(len(html_content), match.end() + 200) context = html_content[start:end] found_date_refs.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'match': match.group(), 'position': match.start(), 'context': context.replace('\n', ' ').strip() }) print(f"June 6, 2023 references found in current HTML: {len(found_date_refs)}") if found_date_refs: print(f"\nüéØ JUNE 6, 2023 REFERENCES FOUND:") for i, ref in enumerate(found_date_refs, 1): print(f" {i}. Pattern: {ref['pattern']}") print(f" Match: {ref['match']}") print(f" Context: ...{ref['context'][:150]}...") # Prepare author page candidates author_page_candidates = [] for link in author_links: if '/author/' in link['href'] and 'carolyn' in link['href'].lower(): author_page_candidates.append(link) # If no direct author page found, construct one if not author_page_candidates: author_page_url = 'https://www.universetoday.com/author/carolyn-collins-petersen/' author_page_candidates = [{ 'url': author_page_url, 'text': 'Carolyn Collins Petersen Author Page (constructed)', 'href': '/author/carolyn-collins-petersen/', 'type': 'constructed' }] print(f"\nAuthor page candidates: {len(author_page_candidates)}") # Now access the author page to find the specific article print(f"\n=== ACCESSING CAROLYN COLLINS PETERSEN AUTHOR PAGE ===\n") import requests import time headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } target_articles = [] for author_candidate in author_page_candidates[:1]: # Try first candidate print(f"Accessing author page: {author_candidate['url']}") try: response = requests.get(author_candidate['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úì Successfully accessed author page (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") # Parse author page author_soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Save author page author_page_file = 'workspace/carolyn_petersen_author_page.html' with open(author_page_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f"Author page saved to: {author_page_file}") # Extract article links from author page print(f"\nExtracting article links from author page...") author_article_links = [] author_all_links = author_soup.find_all('a', href=True) for link in author_all_links: link_href = link.get('href', '') link_text = link.get_text().strip() # Look for article links with 2023 references if (link_href and link_text and len(link_text) > 20 and ('2023' in link_href or '2023' in link_text) and ('universetoday.com' in link_href or link_href.startswith('/'))): full_url = link_href if link_href.startswith('http') else f"https://www.universetoday.com{link_href}" author_article_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': link_text, 'href': link_href }) print(f"Found {len(author_article_links)} 2023 article links on author page") # Check each article for June 6, 2023 date for i, article_link in enumerate(author_article_links[:8], 1): # Check first 8 print(f"\n Checking article {i}: {article_link['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {article_link['url']}") try: article_response = requests.get(article_link['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if article_response.status_code == 200: article_text_lower = article_response.text.lower() # Check for June 6, 2023 using our patterns is_june_6 = False for pattern in june_6_patterns: if re.search(pattern, article_text_lower): is_june_6 = True break if is_june_6: print(f" ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ FOUND TARGET ARTICLE! June 6, 2023 confirmed ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ") # Parse article for research links article_soup = BeautifulSoup(article_response.text, 'html.parser') # Save target article safe_filename = article_link['url'].replace('https://', '').replace('/', '_').replace(':', '_').replace('?', '_').replace('&', '_') target_file = f'workspace/target_article_june_6_2023_{safe_filename}.html' with open(target_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(article_response.text) print(f" ‚úì Target article saved to: {target_file}") # Extract research paper links print(f" üîç Extracting research paper links...") research_links = [] research_indicators = [ 'arxiv.org', 'doi.org', 'nature.com', 'science.org', 'iopscience.iop.org', 'academic.oup.com', 'journals.', 'adsabs.harvard.edu', 'paper', 'study', 'research', 'publication', 'journal', 'proceedings' ] all_article_links = article_soup.find_all('a', href=True) for rlink in all_article_links: rlink_href = rlink.get('href', '') rlink_text = rlink.get_text().strip() # Check if this looks like a research paper link is_research_link = False for indicator in research_indicators: if indicator in rlink_href.lower() or indicator in rlink_text.lower(): is_research_link = True break if is_research_link: research_links.append({ 'url': rlink_href, 'text': rlink_text, 'context': str(rlink.parent)[:200] if rlink.parent else 'N/A' }) print(f" Found {len(research_links)} research paper links") if research_links: print(f"\n üî¨ RESEARCH PAPER LINKS FOUND:") for j, rlink in enumerate(research_links, 1): print(f" {j}. Text: {rlink['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {rlink['url']}") target_articles.append({ 'url': article_link['url'], 'title': article_link['text'], 'filename': target_file, 'research_links': research_links, 'research_count': len(research_links) }) # Found the target, can break break else: print(f" Not June 6, 2023 - continuing search") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed to access (Status: {article_response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Exception: {str(e)}") time.sleep(1) # Be respectful to the server else: print(f"‚úó Failed to access author page (Status: {response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f"‚úó Exception accessing author page: {str(e)}") # Save final results final_results = { 'search_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find Carolyn Collins Petersen June 6, 2023 Universe Today article', 'html_source_analyzed': target_html_file, 'total_links_processed': len(all_links), 'article_links_found': len(article_links), 'author_links_found': len(author_links), 'june_6_refs_in_main_page': len(found_date_refs), 'target_articles_found': len(target_articles), 'target_articles': target_articles } results_file = 'workspace/universe_today_search_final_results.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== FINAL SEARCH RESULTS ===\n") print(f"HTML source analyzed: {target_html_file}") print(f"Total links processed: {len(all_links)}") print(f"Article links found: {len(article_links)}") print(f"Author links found: {len(author_links)}") print(f"Target articles found: {len(target_articles)}") print(f"Results saved to: {results_file}") if target_articles: print(f"\nüéØ SUCCESS! TARGET ARTICLE(S) FOUND:") for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Saved to: {article['filename']}") print(f" Research links found: {article['research_count']}") if article['research_links']: print(f" üìã RESEARCH PAPER LINKS:") for j, rlink in enumerate(article['research_links'], 1): print(f" {j}. {rlink['text'][:50]}...") print(f" {rlink['url']}") print(f"\n‚úÖ PLAN COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY!") print(f"- Found Carolyn Collins Petersen Universe Today article from June 6, 2023") print(f"- Extracted {sum(a['research_count'] for a in target_articles)} research paper link(s)") print(f"- All content saved to workspace for analysis") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No June 6, 2023 articles found") print(f"Searched author page but no exact date match found") else: print("\n‚ö†Ô∏è No HTML files found in workspace") print("Unable to proceed without Universe Today content") print(f"\n=== FINAL WORKSPACE STATUS ===\n") final_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Total files: {len(final_files)}") for file in sorted(final_files): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")
Execution Output
Code Output: === UNIVERSE TODAY ARTICLE SEARCH - FIXED APPROACH === Objective: Find Carolyn Collins Petersen article from June 6, 2023 and extract research paper link === WORKSPACE INSPECTION === Current workspace files: 5 - universe_today_search_results.json (942 bytes) - universe_today_fixed_search_results.json (455 bytes) - universe_today_main_page_raw.html (73,646 bytes) - universe_today_direct_1_Universe_Today_Main_Page.txt (29,070 bytes) - universe_today_main_page_fresh.html (73,646 bytes) HTML files found: 2 === ANALYZING HTML CONTENT: universe_today_main_page_raw.html === HTML content length: 73,524 characters === EXTRACTING ARTICLE LINKS (FIXED APPROACH) === Total links found: 252 Execution error: NameError: name 'href_value' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/liujiarui.1/Documents/È°πÁõÆ/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code """Python interpreter main class""" ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 85, in <module> File "<string>", line 85, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'href_value' is not defined

2025-08-06 20:41:31
Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 9)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime import requests import time print("=== UNIVERSE TODAY ARTICLE SEARCH - SIMPLIFIED APPROACH ===\n") print("Objective: Find Carolyn Collins Petersen article from June 6, 2023 and extract research paper link\n") # Check workspace print("=== WORKSPACE INSPECTION ===\n") workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Current workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}") for file in workspace_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Instead of parsing the main page (which has caused scope issues), # let's go directly to the author page using a constructed URL print("\n=== DIRECT AUTHOR PAGE ACCESS STRATEGY ===\n") print("Bypassing main page parsing to avoid variable scope issues") print("Going directly to Carolyn Collins Petersen's author page...") # Set up headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } # Direct URL to Carolyn Collins Petersen's author page author_page_url = 'https://www.universetoday.com/author/carolyn-collins-petersen/' print(f"\nAccessing author page: {author_page_url}") target_articles = [] try: response = requests.get(author_page_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úì Successfully accessed author page (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") # Parse author page author_soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Save author page author_page_file = 'workspace/carolyn_petersen_author_page.html' with open(author_page_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f"Author page saved to: {author_page_file}") # Search author page text for June 6, 2023 references print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR JUNE 6, 2023 REFERENCES ===\n") author_page_text = response.text.lower() # Define date patterns june_6_patterns = [ r'june 6,? 2023', r'june 6th,? 2023', r'6 june 2023', r'2023-06-06', r'06/06/2023' ] # Check if June 6, 2023 is referenced on the author page june_6_found_on_page = False for pattern in june_6_patterns: if re.search(pattern, author_page_text): june_6_found_on_page = True print(f"‚òÖ Found June 6, 2023 reference on author page using pattern: {pattern}") break if not june_6_found_on_page: print("No direct June 6, 2023 references found on author page") # Extract all article links from author page - using simple approach print(f"\n=== EXTRACTING ARTICLE LINKS FROM AUTHOR PAGE ===\n") all_author_links = author_soup.find_all('a', href=True) print(f"Total links found on author page: {len(all_author_links)}") # Filter for article links - simple loop to avoid scope issues article_links_2023 = [] for link in all_author_links: try: href = link.get('href', '') text = link.get_text().strip() # Skip empty links if not href or not text or len(text) < 15: continue # Look for 2023 articles has_2023 = '2023' in href or '2023' in text is_article = 'universetoday.com' in href or href.startswith('/') if has_2023 and is_article and len(text) > 15: # Make URL absolute if href.startswith('/'): full_url = f"https://www.universetoday.com{href}" else: full_url = href article_links_2023.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': text, 'href': href }) except Exception as e: # Skip problematic links continue print(f"Found {len(article_links_2023)} potential 2023 article links") # Show first few article links for verification if article_links_2023: print(f"\nFirst 5 article links found:") for i, link in enumerate(article_links_2023[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. {link['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {link['url']}") # Now check each article for June 6, 2023 date print(f"\n=== CHECKING ARTICLES FOR JUNE 6, 2023 DATE ===\n") articles_checked = 0 max_articles_to_check = 10 # Limit to avoid timeout for i, article_link in enumerate(article_links_2023): if articles_checked >= max_articles_to_check: print(f"\nReached maximum articles to check ({max_articles_to_check})") break articles_checked += 1 print(f"\nChecking article {articles_checked}: {article_link['text'][:60]}...") print(f"URL: {article_link['url']}") try: article_response = requests.get(article_link['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if article_response.status_code == 200: article_text_lower = article_response.text.lower() # Check for June 6, 2023 using our patterns is_june_6_article = False matching_pattern = None for pattern in june_6_patterns: if re.search(pattern, article_text_lower): is_june_6_article = True matching_pattern = pattern break if is_june_6_article: print(f" ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ FOUND TARGET ARTICLE! June 6, 2023 confirmed (pattern: {matching_pattern}) ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ") # Parse article for research links article_soup = BeautifulSoup(article_response.text, 'html.parser') # Save target article safe_filename = article_link['url'].replace('https://', '').replace('/', '_').replace(':', '_').replace('?', '_').replace('&', '_')[:100] # Limit filename length target_file = f'workspace/target_article_june_6_2023_{safe_filename}.html' with open(target_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(article_response.text) print(f" ‚úì Target article saved to: {target_file}") # Extract research paper links print(f" üîç Extracting research paper links...") research_links = [] research_indicators = [ 'arxiv.org', 'doi.org', 'nature.com', 'science.org', 'iopscience.iop.org', 'academic.oup.com', 'journals.', 'adsabs.harvard.edu', 'paper', 'study', 'research', 'publication', 'journal', 'proceedings' ] all_article_links = article_soup.find_all('a', href=True) for rlink in all_article_links: try: rlink_href = rlink.get('href', '') rlink_text = rlink.get_text().strip() if not rlink_href or not rlink_text: continue # Check if this looks like a research paper link is_research_link = False for indicator in research_indicators: if indicator in rlink_href.lower() or indicator in rlink_text.lower(): is_research_link = True break if is_research_link: research_links.append({ 'url': rlink_href, 'text': rlink_text, 'context': str(rlink.parent)[:200] if rlink.parent else 'N/A' }) except Exception as e: # Skip problematic research links continue print(f" Found {len(research_links)} research paper links") if research_links: print(f"\n üî¨ RESEARCH PAPER LINKS FOUND:") for j, rlink in enumerate(research_links, 1): print(f" {j}. Text: {rlink['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {rlink['url']}") target_articles.append({ 'url': article_link['url'], 'title': article_link['text'], 'filename': target_file, 'research_links': research_links, 'research_count': len(research_links), 'matching_pattern': matching_pattern }) # Found the target, can break print(f" ‚úÖ Target article found and processed!") break else: print(f" Not June 6, 2023 - continuing search") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed to access article (Status: {article_response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Exception accessing article: {str(e)}") # Be respectful to the server time.sleep(1) else: print(f"‚úó Failed to access author page (Status: {response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f"‚úó Exception accessing author page: {str(e)}") # Save final results final_results = { 'search_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find Carolyn Collins Petersen June 6, 2023 Universe Today article', 'strategy': 'Direct author page access to avoid main page parsing issues', 'author_page_url': author_page_url, 'articles_checked': articles_checked if 'articles_checked' in locals() else 0, 'target_articles_found': len(target_articles), 'target_articles': target_articles } results_file = 'workspace/universe_today_direct_search_results.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== FINAL SEARCH RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Strategy: Direct author page access") print(f"Author page URL: {author_page_url}") print(f"Articles checked: {articles_checked if 'articles_checked' in locals() else 0}") print(f"Target articles found: {len(target_articles)}") print(f"Results saved to: {results_file}") if target_articles: print(f"\nüéØ SUCCESS! TARGET ARTICLE FOUND:") for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Saved to: {article['filename']}") print(f" Matching pattern: {article['matching_pattern']}") print(f" Research links found: {article['research_count']}") if article['research_links']: print(f" üìã RESEARCH PAPER LINKS:") for j, rlink in enumerate(article['research_links'], 1): print(f" {j}. {rlink['text'][:50]}...") print(f" {rlink['url']}") print(f"\n‚úÖ PLAN COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY!") print(f"- Found Carolyn Collins Petersen Universe Today article from June 6, 2023") print(f"- Extracted {sum(a['research_count'] for a in target_articles)} research paper link(s)") print(f"- All content saved to workspace for analysis") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No June 6, 2023 articles found") print(f"Checked {articles_checked if 'articles_checked' in locals() else 0} articles but no exact date match found") print(f"\n=== FINAL WORKSPACE STATUS ===\n") final_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Total files: {len(final_files)}") for file in sorted(final_files): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")
Execution Output

Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime import requests import time print("=== UNIVERSE TODAY ARTICLE SEARCH - SIMPLIFIED APPROACH ===\n") print("Objective: Find Carolyn Collins Petersen article from June 6, 2023 and extract research paper link\n") # Check workspace print("=== WORKSPACE INSPECTION ===\n") workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Current workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}") for file in workspace_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Instead of parsing the main page (which has caused scope issues), # let's go directly to the author page using a constructed URL print("\n=== DIRECT AUTHOR PAGE ACCESS STRATEGY ===\n") print("Bypassing main page parsing to avoid variable scope issues") print("Going directly to Carolyn Collins Petersen's author page...") # Set up headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } # Direct URL to Carolyn Collins Petersen's author page author_page_url = 'https://www.universetoday.com/author/carolyn-collins-petersen/' print(f"\nAccessing author page: {author_page_url}") target_articles = [] try: response = requests.get(author_page_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úì Successfully accessed author page (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") # Parse author page author_soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Save author page author_page_file = 'workspace/carolyn_petersen_author_page.html' with open(author_page_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f"Author page saved to: {author_page_file}") # Search author page text for June 6, 2023 references print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR JUNE 6, 2023 REFERENCES ===\n") author_page_text = response.text.lower() # Define date patterns june_6_patterns = [ r'june 6,? 2023', r'june 6th,? 2023', r'6 june 2023', r'2023-06-06', r'06/06/2023' ] # Check if June 6, 2023 is referenced on the author page june_6_found_on_page = False for pattern in june_6_patterns: if re.search(pattern, author_page_text): june_6_found_on_page = True print(f"‚òÖ Found June 6, 2023 reference on author page using pattern: {pattern}") break if not june_6_found_on_page: print("No direct June 6, 2023 references found on author page") # Extract all article links from author page - using simple approach print(f"\n=== EXTRACTING ARTICLE LINKS FROM AUTHOR PAGE ===\n") all_author_links = author_soup.find_all('a', href=True) print(f"Total links found on author page: {len(all_author_links)}") # Filter for article links - simple loop to avoid scope issues article_links_2023 = [] for link in all_author_links: try: href = link.get('href', '') text = link.get_text().strip() # Skip empty links if not href or not text or len(text) < 15: continue # Look for 2023 articles has_2023 = '2023' in href or '2023' in text is_article = 'universetoday.com' in href or href.startswith('/') if has_2023 and is_article and len(text) > 15: # Make URL absolute if href.startswith('/'): full_url = f"https://www.universetoday.com{href}" else: full_url = href article_links_2023.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': text, 'href': href }) except Exception as e: # Skip problematic links continue print(f"Found {len(article_links_2023)} potential 2023 article links") # Show first few article links for verification if article_links_2023: print(f"\nFirst 5 article links found:") for i, link in enumerate(article_links_2023[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. {link['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {link['url']}") # Now check each article for June 6, 2023 date print(f"\n=== CHECKING ARTICLES FOR JUNE 6, 2023 DATE ===\n") articles_checked = 0 max_articles_to_check = 10 # Limit to avoid timeout for i, article_link in enumerate(article_links_2023): if articles_checked >= max_articles_to_check: print(f"\nReached maximum articles to check ({max_articles_to_check})") break articles_checked += 1 print(f"\nChecking article {articles_checked}: {article_link['text'][:60]}...") print(f"URL: {article_link['url']}") try: article_response = requests.get(article_link['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if article_response.status_code == 200: article_text_lower = article_response.text.lower() # Check for June 6, 2023 using our patterns is_june_6_article = False matching_pattern = None for pattern in june_6_patterns: if re.search(pattern, article_text_lower): is_june_6_article = True matching_pattern = pattern break if is_june_6_article: print(f" ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ FOUND TARGET ARTICLE! June 6, 2023 confirmed (pattern: {matching_pattern}) ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ") # Parse article for research links article_soup = BeautifulSoup(article_response.text, 'html.parser') # Save target article safe_filename = article_link['url'].replace('https://', '').replace('/', '_').replace(':', '_').replace('?', '_').replace('&', '_')[:100] # Limit filename length target_file = f'workspace/target_article_june_6_2023_{safe_filename}.html' with open(target_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(article_response.text) print(f" ‚úì Target article saved to: {target_file}") # Extract research paper links print(f" üîç Extracting research paper links...") research_links = [] research_indicators = [ 'arxiv.org', 'doi.org', 'nature.com', 'science.org', 'iopscience.iop.org', 'academic.oup.com', 'journals.', 'adsabs.harvard.edu', 'paper', 'study', 'research', 'publication', 'journal', 'proceedings' ] all_article_links = article_soup.find_all('a', href=True) for rlink in all_article_links: try: rlink_href = rlink.get('href', '') rlink_text = rlink.get_text().strip() if not rlink_href or not rlink_text: continue # Check if this looks like a research paper link is_research_link = False for indicator in research_indicators: if indicator in rlink_href.lower() or indicator in rlink_text.lower(): is_research_link = True break if is_research_link: research_links.append({ 'url': rlink_href, 'text': rlink_text, 'context': str(rlink.parent)[:200] if rlink.parent else 'N/A' }) except Exception as e: # Skip problematic research links continue print(f" Found {len(research_links)} research paper links") if research_links: print(f"\n üî¨ RESEARCH PAPER LINKS FOUND:") for j, rlink in enumerate(research_links, 1): print(f" {j}. Text: {rlink['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {rlink['url']}") target_articles.append({ 'url': article_link['url'], 'title': article_link['text'], 'filename': target_file, 'research_links': research_links, 'research_count': len(research_links), 'matching_pattern': matching_pattern }) # Found the target, can break print(f" ‚úÖ Target article found and processed!") break else: print(f" Not June 6, 2023 - continuing search") else: print(f" ‚úó Failed to access article (Status: {article_response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚úó Exception accessing article: {str(e)}") # Be respectful to the server time.sleep(1) else: print(f"‚úó Failed to access author page (Status: {response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f"‚úó Exception accessing author page: {str(e)}") # Save final results final_results = { 'search_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find Carolyn Collins Petersen June 6, 2023 Universe Today article', 'strategy': 'Direct author page access to avoid main page parsing issues', 'author_page_url': author_page_url, 'articles_checked': articles_checked if 'articles_checked' in locals() else 0, 'target_articles_found': len(target_articles), 'target_articles': target_articles } results_file = 'workspace/universe_today_direct_search_results.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== FINAL SEARCH RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Strategy: Direct author page access") print(f"Author page URL: {author_page_url}") print(f"Articles checked: {articles_checked if 'articles_checked' in locals() else 0}") print(f"Target articles found: {len(target_articles)}") print(f"Results saved to: {results_file}") if target_articles: print(f"\nüéØ SUCCESS! TARGET ARTICLE FOUND:") for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Saved to: {article['filename']}") print(f" Matching pattern: {article['matching_pattern']}") print(f" Research links found: {article['research_count']}") if article['research_links']: print(f" üìã RESEARCH PAPER LINKS:") for j, rlink in enumerate(article['research_links'], 1): print(f" {j}. {rlink['text'][:50]}...") print(f" {rlink['url']}") print(f"\n‚úÖ PLAN COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY!") print(f"- Found Carolyn Collins Petersen Universe Today article from June 6, 2023") print(f"- Extracted {sum(a['research_count'] for a in target_articles)} research paper link(s)") print(f"- All content saved to workspace for analysis") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No June 6, 2023 articles found") print(f"Checked {articles_checked if 'articles_checked' in locals() else 0} articles but no exact date match found") print(f"\n=== FINAL WORKSPACE STATUS ===\n") final_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Total files: {len(final_files)}") for file in sorted(final_files): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")

Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 10)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print("=== UNIVERSE TODAY SEARCH - WORKSPACE-FIRST APPROACH ===\n") print("Objective: Find Carolyn Collins Petersen article from June 6, 2023 and extract research paper link\n") # First, let's thoroughly inspect what we have in the workspace print("=== COMPREHENSIVE WORKSPACE INSPECTION ===\n") workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Current workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}") for file in workspace_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Let's examine the JSON files first to understand previous search results print("\n=== EXAMINING EXISTING JSON SEARCH RESULTS ===\n") json_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.json')] print(f"JSON files found: {len(json_files)}") for json_file in json_files: print(f"\nInspecting: {json_file}") json_path = os.path.join('workspace', json_file) try: with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f"JSON structure for {json_file}:") for key in data.keys(): value = data[key] if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: List with {len(value)} items") if len(value) > 0 and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f" First item keys: {list(value[0].keys())}") elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: Dictionary with {len(value)} keys") print(f" Keys: {list(value.keys())}") elif isinstance(value, str): print(f" {key}: String (length: {len(value)})") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} = {value}") except Exception as e: print(f" Error reading {json_file}: {str(e)}") # Now let's examine the text files print("\n=== EXAMINING TEXT FILES ===\n") txt_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.txt')] print(f"Text files found: {len(txt_files)}") for txt_file in txt_files: print(f"\nInspecting: {txt_file}") txt_path = os.path.join('workspace', txt_file) try: with open(txt_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read() print(f"Content length: {len(content):,} characters") print(f"First 200 characters: {content[:200]}...") # Search for June 6, 2023 references in the text file june_6_patterns = [ r'june 6,? 2023', r'june 6th,? 2023', r'6 june 2023', r'2023-06-06', r'06/06/2023' ] content_lower = content.lower() found_june_refs = [] for pattern in june_6_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, content_lower)) if matches: for match in matches: start = max(0, match.start() - 100) end = min(len(content), match.end() + 100) context = content[start:end].replace('\n', ' ').strip() found_june_refs.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'match': match.group(), 'context': context }) if found_june_refs: print(f" ‚òÖ Found {len(found_june_refs)} June 6, 2023 references!") for i, ref in enumerate(found_june_refs, 1): print(f" {i}. Pattern: {ref['pattern']}") print(f" Context: ...{ref['context'][:150]}...") else: print(f" No June 6, 2023 references found in this text file") except Exception as e: print(f" Error reading {txt_file}: {str(e)}") # Now examine the HTML files more carefully print("\n=== EXAMINING HTML FILES FOR CAROLYN COLLINS PETERSEN ===\n") html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"HTML files found: {len(html_files)}") for html_file in html_files: print(f"\nInspecting: {html_file}") html_path = os.path.join('workspace', html_file) try: with open(html_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f"HTML content length: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Search for Carolyn Collins Petersen references carolyn_patterns = [ 'carolyn collins petersen', 'carolyn petersen', 'c. collins petersen', 'collins petersen' ] html_text_lower = html_content.lower() found_carolyn_refs = [] for pattern in carolyn_patterns: if pattern in html_text_lower: found_carolyn_refs.append(pattern) if found_carolyn_refs: print(f" ‚òÖ Found Carolyn references: {found_carolyn_refs}") # Look for links containing her name or author references all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) author_related_links = [] for link in all_links: href = link.get('href', '') text = link.get_text().strip() # Check if link is related to Carolyn is_carolyn_link = False for pattern in carolyn_patterns: if pattern in href.lower() or pattern in text.lower(): is_carolyn_link = True break if is_carolyn_link: # Make URL absolute if needed if href.startswith('/'): full_url = f"https://www.universetoday.com{href}" else: full_url = href author_related_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'text': text, 'href': href }) print(f" Found {len(author_related_links)} Carolyn-related links:") for i, link in enumerate(author_related_links[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. {link['text'][:60]}...") print(f" URL: {link['url']}") # Save these links for potential use if author_related_links: carolyn_links_file = 'workspace/carolyn_links_extracted.json' with open(carolyn_links_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'source_file': html_file, 'extraction_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'carolyn_patterns_found': found_carolyn_refs, 'links_count': len(author_related_links), 'links': author_related_links }, f, indent=2) print(f" ‚úì Carolyn-related links saved to: {carolyn_links_file}") else: print(f" No Carolyn Collins Petersen references found") # Also search for June 6, 2023 in HTML june_6_patterns = [ r'june 6,? 2023', r'june 6th,? 2023', r'6 june 2023', r'2023-06-06', r'06/06/2023' ] found_june_in_html = [] for pattern in june_6_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, html_text_lower)) if matches: for match in matches: start = max(0, match.start() - 150) end = min(len(html_content), match.end() + 150) context = html_content[start:end].replace('\n', ' ').strip() found_june_in_html.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'match': match.group(), 'context': context }) if found_june_in_html: print(f" ‚òÖ Found {len(found_june_in_html)} June 6, 2023 references in HTML!") for i, ref in enumerate(found_june_in_html, 1): print(f" {i}. Pattern: {ref['pattern']}") print(f" Context: ...{ref['context'][:150]}...") except Exception as e: print(f" Error processing {html_file}: {str(e)}") print("\n=== STRATEGY DECISION BASED ON WORKSPACE ANALYSIS ===\n") # Based on what we found, determine next steps carolyn_links_file = 'workspace/carolyn_links_extracted.json' if os.path.exists(carolyn_links_file): print("‚úì Found Carolyn-related links in existing content") print("Next step: Use these links to access her articles directly") else: print("‚ö†Ô∏è No Carolyn-related links found in existing content") print("Next step: Need to search for alternative author page URLs or use search") print(f"\n=== WORKSPACE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Files analyzed: {len(workspace_files)}") print(f"JSON files: {len(json_files)}") print(f"Text files: {len(txt_files)}") print(f"HTML files: {len(html_files)}") print(f"\nNext phase: Based on the analysis above, we'll determine the best approach") print(f"to find the June 6, 2023 article by Carolyn Collins Petersen.")
Execution Output
