Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print("=== ANALYZING EXISTING WORKSPACE FILES FOR CAROLYN COLLINS PETERSEN ARTICLES ===\n") print("Objective: Parse existing workspace files to find June 2023 articles by Carolyn Collins Petersen") print("Focus: Articles discussing astronomical observations, research teams, or R. G. Arendt\n") # First, let's inspect the workspace directory structure workspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir('.') if d.startswith('workspace')] if not workspace_dirs: print("‚ùå No workspace directory found") else: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") print(f"Directory path: {workspace_dir}/\n") # List all files to understand what we have workspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) print(f"Total files in workspace: {len(workspace_files)}") # Categorize files by type json_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.json')] html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] txt_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.txt')] print(f"\nFile breakdown:") print(f"- JSON files: {len(json_files)}") print(f"- HTML files: {len(html_files)}") print(f"- TXT files: {len(txt_files)}") print(f"\nAll files in workspace:") for i, file in enumerate(sorted(workspace_files), 1): file_size = os.path.getsize(os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)) print(f" {i}. {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Let's start by examining the most promising files print(f"\n=== EXAMINING PROMISING JSON FILES ===\n") # First, let's inspect the JSON files to understand their structure promising_json_files = [] for json_file in json_files: if any(keyword in json_file.lower() for keyword in ['carolyn', 'final', 'success', 'comprehensive']): promising_json_files.append(json_file) for json_file in promising_json_files: json_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, json_file) print(f"\nüìÑ INSPECTING: {json_file}") print(f"File size: {os.path.getsize(json_path):,} bytes") try: with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f"JSON structure:") if isinstance(data, dict): for key in data.keys(): value = data[key] if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: List with {len(value)} items") if len(value) > 0: print(f" Sample item type: {type(value[0]).__name__}") if isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f" Sample item keys: {list(value[0].keys())[:5]}") elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: Dictionary with {len(value)} keys") print(f" Keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}") elif isinstance(value, str): print(f" {key}: String (length: {len(value)})") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {value}") elif isinstance(data, list): print(f" Root: List with {len(data)} items") if len(data) > 0: print(f" Sample item type: {type(data[0]).__name__}") if isinstance(data[0], dict): print(f" Sample item keys: {list(data[0].keys())}") except Exception as e: print(f" Error reading JSON: {str(e)}") # Now let's examine the Carolyn Petersen author page HTML file carolyn_html_file = None for file in html_files: if 'carolyn' in file.lower(): carolyn_html_file = file break if carolyn_html_file: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING CAROLYN PETERSEN AUTHOR PAGE ===\n") carolyn_html_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, carolyn_html_file) print(f"File: {carolyn_html_file}") print(f"Size: {os.path.getsize(carolyn_html_path):,} bytes") try: with open(carolyn_html_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Extract page title page_title = soup.find('title') if page_title: print(f"\nPage title: {page_title.get_text().strip()}") # Look for article links or listings print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR ARTICLE LINKS ===\n") # Find all links in the page all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) print(f"Total links found: {len(all_links)}") # Filter for article links article_links = [] for link in all_links: href = link.get('href', '') text = link.get_text().strip() # Filter for likely article links (longer text, contains relevant keywords) if (text and len(text) > 15 and any(keyword in text.lower() for keyword in ['space', 'astronomy', 'telescope', 'nasa', 'research', 'cosmic', 'star', 'galaxy', 'planet', 'universe'])): article_links.append({ 'url': href, 'title': text }) print(f"Astronomy-related article links found: {len(article_links)}") # Look specifically for June 2023 articles june_2023_articles = [] for link in article_links: title = link['title'].lower() url = link['url'].lower() # Check for June 2023 indicators june_indicators = ['june 2023', 'june 6', 'june 1', 'june 2', 'june 3', 'june 4', 'june 5', 'june 7', 'june 8', 'june 9', 'june 10', '2023/06'] has_june_2023 = any(indicator in title or indicator in url for indicator in june_indicators) # Check for research/observation keywords research_keywords = ['research', 'team', 'observations', 'study', 'scientists', 'arendt', 'funding', 'paper', 'published'] has_research = any(keyword in title for keyword in research_keywords) if has_june_2023 or has_research: june_2023_articles.append({ 'title': link['title'], 'url': link['url'], 'has_june_2023': has_june_2023, 'has_research': has_research, 'relevance_score': sum([has_june_2023, has_research]) }) print(f"\nüéØ JUNE 2023 / RESEARCH ARTICLES FOUND: {len(june_2023_articles)}") if june_2023_articles: # Sort by relevance june_2023_articles.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) for i, article in enumerate(june_2023_articles, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" June 2023: {article['has_june_2023']}") print(f" Research terms: {article['has_research']}") print(f" Relevance score: {article['relevance_score']}") # Search page text for specific date patterns print(f"\n=== SEARCHING PAGE TEXT FOR JUNE 2023 REFERENCES ===\n") page_text = soup.get_text() # Look for specific date patterns date_patterns = [ r'June\s+[1-9]\d*,?\s+2023', r'[1-9]\d*\s+June\s+2023', r'2023-06-[0-9]{2}', r'06/[0-9]{2}/2023' ] found_dates = [] for pattern in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: context_start = max(0, match.start() - 100) context_end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 100) context = page_text[context_start:context_end].strip() found_dates.append({ 'date': match.group(), 'context': context }) if found_dates: print(f"Found {len(found_dates)} date references:") for i, date_ref in enumerate(found_dates[:5], 1): # Show first 5 print(f"\n{i}. Date: {date_ref['date']}") print(f" Context: {date_ref['context'][:200]}...") else: print("No specific June 2023 date references found in page text") # Search for R. G. Arendt specifically arendt_pattern = r'R\.?\s*G\.?\s*Arendt|Arendt' arendt_matches = list(re.finditer(arendt_pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE)) if arendt_matches: print(f"\n=== R. G. ARENDT REFERENCES FOUND: {len(arendt_matches)} ===\n") for i, match in enumerate(arendt_matches, 1): context_start = max(0, match.start() - 150) context_end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 150) context = page_text[context_start:context_end].strip() print(f"{i}. Match: {match.group()}") print(f" Context: {context}") print() else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No R. G. Arendt references found in the author page") except Exception as e: print(f"Error analyzing HTML file: {str(e)}") # Now let's examine the most comprehensive JSON file for article data print(f"\n=== ANALYZING COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH RESULTS JSON ===\n") # Look for the comprehensive results file comprehensive_json = None for json_file in json_files: if 'comprehensive' in json_file.lower() and os.path.getsize(os.path.join(workspace_dir, json_file)) > 5000: comprehensive_json = json_file break if comprehensive_json: json_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, comprehensive_json) print(f"üìä ANALYZING: {comprehensive_json}") print(f"File size: {os.path.getsize(json_path):,} bytes") try: with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: comprehensive_data = json.load(f) print(f"\nData structure analysis:") if isinstance(comprehensive_data, dict): for key, value in comprehensive_data.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: List with {len(value)} items") if len(value) > 0 and isinstance(value[0], dict): sample_keys = list(value[0].keys()) print(f" Sample item keys: {sample_keys[:10]}") elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: Dictionary with {len(value)} keys") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:100]}") # Look for article data in the comprehensive results articles_found = [] # Try different possible keys that might contain article data possible_article_keys = ['articles', 'results', 'links', 'carolyn_articles', 'search_results', 'extracted_articles'] for key in possible_article_keys: if key in comprehensive_data and isinstance(comprehensive_data[key], list): articles_found = comprehensive_data[key] print(f"\nFound articles in key: '{key}' with {len(articles_found)} items") break if not articles_found and isinstance(comprehensive_data, list): articles_found = comprehensive_data print(f"\nUsing root list with {len(articles_found)} items") if articles_found: # Analyze the first few articles to understand structure print(f"\nAnalyzing article structure (first 3 items):") for i, article in enumerate(articles_found[:3]): print(f"\nArticle {i+1} structure:") if isinstance(article, dict): for k, v in article.items(): display_value = str(v)[:100] + '...' if len(str(v)) > 100 else str(v) print(f" {k}: {type(v).__name__} - {display_value}") else: print(f" Type: {type(article).__name__} - {str(article)[:100]}") # Filter for June 2023 and research-related articles relevant_articles = [] for article in articles_found: if isinstance(article, dict): # Extract title and URL from various possible keys title = '' url = '' # Try different title keys for title_key in ['title', 'text', 'name', 'headline']: if title_key in article and article[title_key]: title = str(article[title_key]).lower() break # Try different URL keys for url_key in ['url', 'link', 'href', 'src']: if url_key in article and article[url_key]: url = str(article[url_key]).lower() break if title or url: # Only process if we have some content # Check for June 2023 indicators june_indicators = ['june 2023', 'june 6', 'june 1', 'june 2', 'june 3', 'june 4', 'june 5', 'june 7', 'june 8', 'june 9', 'june 10', '2023/06', '2023-06'] has_june_2023 = any(indicator in title or indicator in url for indicator in june_indicators) # Check for research keywords research_keywords = ['research', 'team', 'observations', 'study', 'scientists', 'arendt', 'funding', 'paper', 'published', 'telescope', 'nasa'] has_research = any(keyword in title for keyword in research_keywords) # Check for Carolyn Collins Petersen carolyn_indicators = ['carolyn', 'petersen', 'peterson'] has_carolyn = any(indicator in title or indicator in url for indicator in carolyn_indicators) if has_june_2023 or has_research or has_carolyn: relevant_articles.append({ 'original_data': article, 'title': article.get('title', article.get('text', 'No title')), 'url': article.get('url', article.get('link', article.get('href', 'No URL'))), 'has_june_2023': has_june_2023, 'has_research': has_research, 'has_carolyn': has_carolyn, 'relevance_score': sum([has_june_2023, has_research, has_carolyn]) }) print(f"\nüéØ RELEVANT ARTICLES FROM COMPREHENSIVE JSON: {len(relevant_articles)}") if relevant_articles: # Sort by relevance relevant_articles.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) for i, article in enumerate(relevant_articles[:10], 1): # Show top 10 print(f"\n{i}. {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" June 2023: {article['has_june_2023']}") print(f" Research terms: {article['has_research']}") print(f" Carolyn reference: {article['has_carolyn']}") print(f" Relevance score: {article['relevance_score']}") # Show additional fields if available original = article['original_data'] for key, value in original.items(): if key not in ['title', 'url', 'link', 'href', 'text'] and value: display_value = str(value)[:100] + '...' if len(str(value)) > 100 else str(value) print(f" {key}: {display_value}") except Exception as e: print(f"Error analyzing comprehensive JSON: {str(e)}") # Let's also check the carolyn_links_extracted.json file specifically carolyn_links_file = 'carolyn_links_extracted.json' if carolyn_links_file in json_files: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING CAROLYN LINKS EXTRACTED JSON ===\n") json_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, carolyn_links_file) print(f"üìä ANALYZING: {carolyn_links_file}") print(f"File size: {os.path.getsize(json_path):,} bytes") try: with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: carolyn_data = json.load(f) print(f"\nCarolyn links data structure:") if isinstance(carolyn_data, dict): for key, value in carolyn_data.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: List with {len(value)} items") if len(value) > 0: print(f" Sample item: {str(value[0])[:100]}") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:100]}") elif isinstance(carolyn_data, list): print(f" Root: List with {len(carolyn_data)} items") if len(carolyn_data) > 0: print(f" Sample item: {str(carolyn_data[0])[:200]}") # Extract and analyze Carolyn's article links if isinstance(carolyn_data, list): carolyn_articles = carolyn_data elif isinstance(carolyn_data, dict) and 'links' in carolyn_data: carolyn_articles = carolyn_data['links'] else: carolyn_articles = [] if carolyn_articles: print(f"\nüìù CAROLYN'S ARTICLES ANALYSIS ({len(carolyn_articles)} articles):") # Look for June 2023 articles june_articles = [] for article in carolyn_articles: if isinstance(article, dict): title = article.get('title', article.get('text', '')).lower() url = article.get('url', article.get('link', '')).lower() else: title = str(article).lower() url = '' # Check for June 2023 and research terms june_indicators = ['june 2023', 'june 6', 'june 1', 'june 2', 'june 3', 'june 4', 'june 5', 'june 7', 'june 8', 'june 9', 'june 10', '2023/06'] research_keywords = ['research', 'team', 'observations', 'study', 'scientists', 'arendt', 'funding', 'paper', 'published', 'telescope', 'nasa'] has_june_2023 = any(indicator in title or indicator in url for indicator in june_indicators) has_research = any(keyword in title for keyword in research_keywords) if has_june_2023 or has_research: june_articles.append({ 'data': article, 'has_june_2023': has_june_2023, 'has_research': has_research }) print(f"\nüéØ JUNE 2023/RESEARCH ARTICLES FROM CAROLYN LINKS: {len(june_articles)}") for i, article in enumerate(june_articles, 1): print(f"\n{i}. Article data: {str(article['data'])[:200]}...") print(f" June 2023: {article['has_june_2023']}") print(f" Research terms: {article['has_research']}") except Exception as e: print(f"Error analyzing Carolyn links JSON: {str(e)}") # Create a summary of our findings analysis_summary = { 'analysis_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find Carolyn Collins Petersen articles from early June 2023', 'workspace_directory': workspace_dir, 'total_files_analyzed': len(workspace_files), 'json_files_count': len(json_files), 'html_files_count': len(html_files), 'key_findings': { 'carolyn_author_page_analyzed': carolyn_html_file is not None, 'june_2023_articles_found': len(june_2023_articles) if 'june_2023_articles' in locals() else 0, 'arendt_references_found': len(arendt_matches) if 'arendt_matches' in locals() else 0, 'comprehensive_json_articles': len(relevant_articles) if 'relevant_articles' in locals() else 0, 'carolyn_links_articles': len(june_articles) if 'june_articles' in locals() else 0 } } # Save analysis summary analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'carolyn_petersen_analysis_summary.json') with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_summary, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Analysis summary:") print(f"- Total files analyzed: {len(workspace_files)}") print(f"- JSON files: {len(json_files)}") print(f"- HTML files: {len(html_files)}") if 'june_2023_articles' in locals(): print(f"- June 2023 articles found in HTML: {len(june_2023_articles)}") if 'arendt_matches' in locals(): print(f"- R. G. Arendt references: {len(arendt_matches)}") if 'relevant_articles' in locals(): print(f"- Relevant articles from comprehensive JSON: {len(relevant_articles)}") if 'june_articles' in locals(): print(f"- June 2023/research articles from Carolyn links: {len(june_articles)}") print(f"\nAnalysis saved to: {analysis_file}") print(f"\nüìã SUMMARY OF FINDINGS:") print(f"Based on the analysis of existing workspace files, I have:") print(f"1. Examined 15 files including HTML author pages and JSON search results") print(f"2. Parsed the Carolyn Petersen author page for article links") print(f"3. Searched for June 2023 date references and R. G. Arendt mentions") print(f"4. Analyzed comprehensive search results for relevant articles") print(f"5. Extracted Carolyn's article links for targeted analysis") if 'june_2023_articles' in locals() and june_2023_articles: print(f"\nüéØ KEY FINDING: Found {len(june_2023_articles)} potentially relevant articles!") elif 'relevant_articles' in locals() and relevant_articles: print(f"\nüéØ KEY FINDING: Found {len(relevant_articles)} relevant articles from search data!") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No specific June 2023 articles by Carolyn Collins Petersen found in current data") print(f"This suggests the article may need to be accessed directly from Universe Today")

G. Arendt Using workspace directory: workspace_840bfca7-4f7b-481a-8794-c560c340185d Directory path: workspace_840bfca7-4f7b-481a-8794-c560c340185d/ Total files in workspace: 15 File breakdown: - JSON files: 11 - HTML files: 3 - TXT files: 1 All files in workspace: 1. FINAL_COMPREHENSIVE_SEARCH_RESULTS.json (2,110 bytes) 3. astronomical_events_june_6_2023_search.json (420 bytes) 4. carolyn_links_extracted.json (733 bytes) 5. carolyn_petersen_author_page_correct.html (33,684 bytes) 6. carolyn_petersen_universe_today_search.json (1,241 bytes) 7. targeted_june_6_search_results.json (248 bytes) 8. universe_today_direct_1_Universe_Today_Main_Page.txt (29,070 bytes) 9. universe_today_direct_search_results.json (370 bytes) 10. universe_today_final_results.json (314 bytes) 11. universe_today_final_success_results.json (355 bytes) 12. universe_today_fixed_search_results.json (455 bytes) 13. universe_today_main_page_fresh.html (73,646 bytes) 14. universe_today_main_page_raw.html (73,646 bytes) 15. universe_today_search_results.json (942 bytes) === EXAMINING PROMISING JSON FILES === Execution error: NameError: name 'json_file' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/liujiarui.1/Documents/È°πÁõÆ/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code """Python interpreter main class""" ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 45, in <module> File "<string>", line 45, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'json_file' is not defined
